Renderer  0.5
A cross-platform Vulkan-based path tracing rendering library.
imgui.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 // dear imgui, v1.77 WIP
2 // (headers)
3 
4 // Help:
5 // - Read FAQ at http://dearimgui.org/faq
6 // - Newcomers, read 'Programmer guide' in imgui.cpp for notes on how to setup Dear ImGui in your codebase.
7 // - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in imgui_demo.cpp. All applications in examples/ are doing that.
8 // Read imgui.cpp for details, links and comments.
9 
10 // Resources:
11 // - FAQ http://dearimgui.org/faq
12 // - Homepage & latest https://github.com/ocornut/imgui

19 /*
20 
21 Index of this file:
22 // Header mess
23 // Forward declarations and basic types
24 // ImGui API (Dear ImGui end-user API)
25 // Flags & Enumerations
26 // Memory allocations macros
27 // ImVector<>
28 // ImGuiStyle
29 // ImGuiIO
30 // Misc data structures (ImGuiInputTextCallbackData, ImGuiSizeCallbackData, ImGuiWindowClass, ImGuiPayload)
31 // Obsolete functions
32 // Helpers (ImGuiOnceUponAFrame, ImGuiTextFilter, ImGuiTextBuffer, ImGuiStorage, ImGuiListClipper, ImColor)
33 // Draw List API (ImDrawCallback, ImDrawCmd, ImDrawIdx, ImDrawVert, ImDrawChannel, ImDrawListSplitter, ImDrawListFlags, ImDrawList, ImDrawData)
34 // Font API (ImFontConfig, ImFontGlyph, ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder, ImFontAtlasFlags, ImFontAtlas, ImFont)
35 // Platform interface for multi-viewport support (ImGuiPlatformIO, ImGuiPlatformMonitor, ImGuiViewportFlags, ImGuiViewport)
36 
37 */
38 
39 #pragma once
40 
41 // Configuration file with compile-time options (edit imconfig.h or #define IMGUI_USER_CONFIG to your own filename)
42 #ifdef IMGUI_USER_CONFIG
43 #include IMGUI_USER_CONFIG
44 #endif
45 #if !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_INCLUDE_IMCONFIG_H) || defined(IMGUI_INCLUDE_IMCONFIG_H)
46 #include "imconfig.h"
47 #endif
48 
49 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
50

52 // Header mess
53 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
54 
55 // Includes
56 #include <float.h> // FLT_MIN, FLT_MAX
57 #include <stdarg.h> // va_list, va_start, va_end
58 #include <stddef.h> // ptrdiff_t, NULL
59 #include <string.h> // memset, memmove, memcpy, strlen, strchr, strcpy, strcmp
60 
61 // Version
62 // (Integer encoded as XYYZZ for use in #if preprocessor conditionals. Work in progress versions typically starts at XYY99 then bounce up to XYY00, XYY01 etc. when release tagging happens)
63 #define IMGUI_VERSION "1.77 WIP"
64 #define IMGUI_VERSION_NUM 17601
65 #define IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(IMGUI_VERSION, sizeof(ImGuiIO), sizeof(ImGuiStyle), sizeof(ImVec2), sizeof(ImVec4), sizeof(ImDrawVert), sizeof(ImDrawIdx))
66 #define IMGUI_HAS_VIEWPORT 1 // Viewport WIP branch
67 #define IMGUI_HAS_DOCK 1 // Docking WIP branch
68 
69 // Define attributes of all API symbols declarations (e.g. for DLL under Windows)
70 // IMGUI_API is used for core imgui functions, IMGUI_IMPL_API is used for the default bindings files (imgui_impl_xxx.h)
71 // Using dear imgui via a shared library is not recommended, because we don't guarantee backward nor forward ABI compatibility (also function call overhead, as dear imgui is a call-heavy API)
72 #include "Core.hpp"
73 #ifndef IMGUI_API
74 #define IMGUI_API RX_API
75 #endif
76 #ifndef IMGUI_IMPL_API
77 #define IMGUI_IMPL_API IMGUI_API
78 #endif
79 
80 // Helper Macros
81 #ifndef IM_ASSERT
82 #include <assert.h>
83 #define IM_ASSERT(_EXPR) assert(_EXPR) // You can override the default assert handler by editing imconfig.h
84 #endif
85 #if !defined(IMGUI_USE_STB_SPRINTF) && (defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__))
86 #define IM_FMTARGS(FMT) __attribute__((format(printf, FMT, FMT+1))) // To apply printf-style warnings to our functions.
87 #define IM_FMTLIST(FMT) __attribute__((format(printf, FMT, 0)))
88 #else
89 #define IM_FMTARGS(FMT)
90 #define IM_FMTLIST(FMT)
91 #endif
92 #define IM_ARRAYSIZE(_ARR) ((int)(sizeof(_ARR) / sizeof(*_ARR))) // Size of a static C-style array. Don't use on pointers!
93 #define IM_UNUSED(_VAR) ((void)_VAR) // Used to silence "unused variable warnings". Often useful as asserts may be stripped out from final builds.
94 #if (__cplusplus >= 201100)
95 #define IM_OFFSETOF(_TYPE,_MEMBER) offsetof(_TYPE, _MEMBER) // Offset of _MEMBER within _TYPE. Standardized as offsetof() in C++11
96 #else
97 #define IM_OFFSETOF(_TYPE,_MEMBER) ((size_t)&(((_TYPE*)0)->_MEMBER)) // Offset of _MEMBER within _TYPE. Old style macro.
98 #endif
99 
100 // Warnings
101 #if defined(__clang__)
102 #pragma clang diagnostic push
103 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast"
104 #if __has_warning("-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant")
105 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant"
106 #endif
107 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
108 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
109 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas" // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind
110 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-memaccess" // [__GNUC__ >= 8] warning: 'memset/memcpy' clearing/writing an object of type 'xxxx' with no trivial copy-assignment; use assignment or value-initialization instead
111 #endif
112 
113 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
114 // Forward declarations and basic types
115 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
116 
117 // Forward declarations
118 struct ImDrawChannel; // Temporary storage to output draw commands out of order, used by ImDrawListSplitter and ImDrawList::ChannelsSplit()
119 struct ImDrawCmd; // A single draw command within a parent ImDrawList (generally maps to 1 GPU draw call, unless it is a callback)
120 struct ImDrawData; // All draw command lists required to render the frame + pos/size coordinates to use for the projection matrix.
121 struct ImDrawList; // A single draw command list (generally one per window, conceptually you may see this as a dynamic "mesh" builder)
122 struct ImDrawListSharedData; // Data shared among multiple draw lists (typically owned by parent ImGui context, but you may create one yourself)
123 struct ImDrawListSplitter; // Helper to split a draw list into different layers which can be drawn into out of order, then flattened back.
124 struct ImDrawVert; // A single vertex (pos + uv + col = 20 bytes by default. Override layout with IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT)
125 struct ImFont; // Runtime data for a single font within a parent ImFontAtlas
126 struct ImFontAtlas; // Runtime data for multiple fonts, bake multiple fonts into a single texture, TTF/OTF font loader
127 struct ImFontConfig; // Configuration data when adding a font or merging fonts
128 struct ImFontGlyph; // A single font glyph (code point + coordinates within in ImFontAtlas + offset)
129 struct ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder; // Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data
130 struct ImColor; // Helper functions to create a color that can be converted to either u32 or float4 (*OBSOLETE* please avoid using)
131 struct ImGuiContext; // Dear ImGui context (opaque structure, unless including imgui_internal.h)
132 struct ImGuiIO; // Main configuration and I/O between your application and ImGui
133 struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData; // Shared state of InputText() when using custom ImGuiInputTextCallback (rare/advanced use)
134 struct ImGuiListClipper; // Helper to manually clip large list of items
135 struct ImGuiOnceUponAFrame; // Helper for running a block of code not more than once a frame, used by IMGUI_ONCE_UPON_A_FRAME macro
136 struct ImGuiPayload; // User data payload for drag and drop operations
137 struct ImGuiPlatformIO; // Multi-viewport support: interface for Platform/Renderer back-ends + viewports to render
138 struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor; // Multi-viewport support: user-provided bounds for each connected monitor/display. Used when positioning popups and tooltips to avoid them straddling monitors
139 struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData; // Callback data when using SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() (rare/advanced use)
140 struct ImGuiStorage; // Helper for key->value storage
141 struct ImGuiStyle; // Runtime data for styling/colors
142 struct ImGuiTextBuffer; // Helper to hold and append into a text buffer (~string builder)
143 struct ImGuiTextFilter; // Helper to parse and apply text filters (e.g. "aaaaa[,bbbbb][,ccccc]")
144 struct ImGuiViewport; // Viewport (generally ~1 per window to output to at the OS level. Need per-platform support to use multiple viewports)
145 struct ImGuiWindowClass; // Window class (rare/advanced uses: provide hints to the platform back-end via altered viewport flags and parent/child info)
146 
147 // Enums/Flags (declared as int for compatibility with old C++, to allow using as flags and to not pollute the top of this file)
148 // - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _central column_ below to find the actual flags/enum lists!
149 // In Visual Studio IDE: CTRL+comma ("Edit.NavigateTo") can follow symbols in comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
150 // With Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols in comments.
151 typedef int ImGuiCol; // -> enum ImGuiCol_ // Enum: A color identifier for styling
152 typedef int ImGuiCond; // -> enum ImGuiCond_ // Enum: A condition for many Set*() functions
153 typedef int ImGuiDataType; // -> enum ImGuiDataType_ // Enum: A primary data type
154 typedef int ImGuiDir; // -> enum ImGuiDir_ // Enum: A cardinal direction
155 typedef int ImGuiKey; // -> enum ImGuiKey_ // Enum: A key identifier (ImGui-side enum)
156 typedef int ImGuiNavInput; // -> enum ImGuiNavInput_ // Enum: An input identifier for navigation
157 typedef int ImGuiMouseButton; // -> enum ImGuiMouseButton_ // Enum: A mouse button identifier (0=left, 1=right, 2=middle)
158 typedef int ImGuiMouseCursor; // -> enum ImGuiMouseCursor_ // Enum: A mouse cursor identifier
159 typedef int ImGuiStyleVar; // -> enum ImGuiStyleVar_ // Enum: A variable identifier for styling
160 typedef int ImDrawCornerFlags; // -> enum ImDrawCornerFlags_ // Flags: for ImDrawList::AddRect(), AddRectFilled() etc.
161 typedef int ImDrawListFlags; // -> enum ImDrawListFlags_ // Flags: for ImDrawList
162 typedef int ImFontAtlasFlags; // -> enum ImFontAtlasFlags_ // Flags: for ImFontAtlas
163 typedef int ImGuiBackendFlags; // -> enum ImGuiBackendFlags_ // Flags: for io.BackendFlags
164 typedef int ImGuiColorEditFlags; // -> enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_ // Flags: for ColorEdit4(), ColorPicker4() etc.
165 typedef int ImGuiConfigFlags; // -> enum ImGuiConfigFlags_ // Flags: for io.ConfigFlags
166 typedef int ImGuiComboFlags; // -> enum ImGuiComboFlags_ // Flags: for BeginCombo()
167 typedef int ImGuiDockNodeFlags; // -> enum ImGuiDockNodeFlags_ // Flags: for DockSpace()
168 typedef int ImGuiDragDropFlags; // -> enum ImGuiDragDropFlags_ // Flags: for BeginDragDropSource(), AcceptDragDropPayload()
169 typedef int ImGuiFocusedFlags; // -> enum ImGuiFocusedFlags_ // Flags: for IsWindowFocused()
170 typedef int ImGuiHoveredFlags; // -> enum ImGuiHoveredFlags_ // Flags: for IsItemHovered(), IsWindowHovered() etc.
171 typedef int ImGuiInputTextFlags; // -> enum ImGuiInputTextFlags_ // Flags: for InputText(), InputTextMultiline()
172 typedef int ImGuiKeyModFlags; // -> enum ImGuiKeyModFlags_ // Flags: for io.KeyMods (Ctrl/Shift/Alt/Super)
173 typedef int ImGuiSelectableFlags; // -> enum ImGuiSelectableFlags_ // Flags: for Selectable()
174 typedef int ImGuiTabBarFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTabBarFlags_ // Flags: for BeginTabBar()
175 typedef int ImGuiTabItemFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTabItemFlags_ // Flags: for BeginTabItem()
176 typedef int ImGuiTreeNodeFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ // Flags: for TreeNode(), TreeNodeEx(), CollapsingHeader()
177 typedef int ImGuiViewportFlags; // -> enum ImGuiViewportFlags_ // Flags: for ImGuiViewport
178 typedef int ImGuiWindowFlags; // -> enum ImGuiWindowFlags_ // Flags: for Begin(), BeginChild()
179 
180 // Other types
181 #ifndef ImTextureID // ImTextureID [configurable type: override in imconfig.h with '#define ImTextureID xxx']
182 typedef void* ImTextureID; // User data for rendering back-end to identify a texture. This is whatever to you want it to be! read the FAQ about ImTextureID for details.
183 #endif
184 typedef unsigned int ImGuiID; // A unique ID used by widgets, typically hashed from a stack of string.
185 typedef int (*ImGuiInputTextCallback)(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData *data);
186 typedef void (*ImGuiSizeCallback)(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data);
187 
188 // Decoded character types
189 // (we generally use UTF-8 encoded string in the API. This is storage specifically for a decoded character used for keyboard input and display)
190 typedef unsigned short ImWchar16; // A single decoded U16 character/code point. We encode them as multi bytes UTF-8 when used in strings.
191 typedef unsigned int ImWchar32; // A single decoded U32 character/code point. We encode them as multi bytes UTF-8 when used in strings.
192 #ifdef IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32 // ImWchar [configurable type: override in imconfig.h with '#define IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32' to support Unicode planes 1-16]
193 typedef ImWchar32 ImWchar;
194 #else
195 typedef ImWchar16 ImWchar;
196 #endif
197 
198 // Basic scalar data types
199 typedef signed char ImS8; // 8-bit signed integer
200 typedef unsigned char ImU8; // 8-bit unsigned integer
201 typedef signed short ImS16; // 16-bit signed integer
202 typedef unsigned short ImU16; // 16-bit unsigned integer
203 typedef signed int ImS32; // 32-bit signed integer == int
204 typedef unsigned int ImU32; // 32-bit unsigned integer (often used to store packed colors)
205 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__)
206 typedef signed __int64 ImS64; // 64-bit signed integer (pre and post C++11 with Visual Studio)
207 typedef unsigned __int64 ImU64; // 64-bit unsigned integer (pre and post C++11 with Visual Studio)
208 #elif (defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__)) && (__cplusplus < 201100)
209 #include <stdint.h>
210 typedef int64_t ImS64; // 64-bit signed integer (pre C++11)
211 typedef uint64_t ImU64; // 64-bit unsigned integer (pre C++11)
212 #else
213 typedef signed long long ImS64; // 64-bit signed integer (post C++11)
214 typedef unsigned long long ImU64; // 64-bit unsigned integer (post C++11)
215 #endif
216 
217 // 2D vector (often used to store positions or sizes)
218 struct ImVec2
219 {
220  float x, y;
221  ImVec2() { x = y = 0.0f; }
222  ImVec2(float _x, float _y) { x = _x; y = _y; }
223  float operator[] (size_t idx) const { IM_ASSERT(idx <= 1); return (&x)[idx]; } // We very rarely use this [] operator, the assert overhead is fine.
224  float& operator[] (size_t idx) { IM_ASSERT(idx <= 1); return (&x)[idx]; } // We very rarely use this [] operator, the assert overhead is fine.
225 #ifdef IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA
226  IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA // Define additional constructors and implicit cast operators in imconfig.h to convert back and forth between your math types and ImVec2.
227 #endif
228 };
229 
230 // 4D vector (often used to store floating-point colors)
231 struct ImVec4
232 {
233  float x, y, z, w;
234  ImVec4() { x = y = z = w = 0.0f; }
235  ImVec4(float _x, float _y, float _z, float _w) { x = _x; y = _y; z = _z; w = _w; }
236 #ifdef IM_VEC4_CLASS_EXTRA
237  IM_VEC4_CLASS_EXTRA // Define additional constructors and implicit cast operators in imconfig.h to convert back and forth between your math types and ImVec4.
238 #endif
239 };
240 
241 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
242 // ImGui: Dear ImGui end-user API
243 // (This is a namespace. You can add extra ImGui:: functions in your own separate file. Please don't modify imgui source files!)
244 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
245 
246 namespace ImGui
247 {
248  // Context creation and access
249  // Each context create its own ImFontAtlas by default. You may instance one yourself and pass it to CreateContext() to share a font atlas between imgui contexts.
250  // None of those functions is reliant on the current context.
251  IMGUI_API ImGuiContext* CreateContext(ImFontAtlas* shared_font_atlas = NULL);
252  IMGUI_API void DestroyContext(ImGuiContext* ctx = NULL); // NULL = destroy current context
253  IMGUI_API ImGuiContext* GetCurrentContext();
254  IMGUI_API void SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext* ctx);
255 
256  // Main
257  IMGUI_API ImGuiIO& GetIO(); // access the IO structure (mouse/keyboard/gamepad inputs, time, various configuration options/flags)
258  IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle& GetStyle(); // access the Style structure (colors, sizes). Always use PushStyleCol(), PushStyleVar() to modify style mid-frame!
259  IMGUI_API void NewFrame(); // start a new Dear ImGui frame, you can submit any command from this point until Render()/EndFrame().
260  IMGUI_API void EndFrame(); // ends the Dear ImGui frame. automatically called by Render(). If you don't need to render data (skipping rendering) you may call EndFrame() without Render()... but you'll have wasted CPU already! If you don't need to render, better to not create any windows and not call NewFrame() at all!
261  IMGUI_API void Render(); // ends the Dear ImGui frame, finalize the draw data. You can get call GetDrawData() to obtain it and run your rendering function (up to v1.60, this used to call io.RenderDrawListsFn(). Nowadays, we allow and prefer calling your render function yourself.)
262  IMGUI_API ImDrawData* GetDrawData(); // valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame(). this is what you have to render.
263 
264  // Demo, Debug, Information
265  IMGUI_API void ShowDemoWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create Demo window (previously called ShowTestWindow). demonstrate most ImGui features. call this to learn about the library! try to make it always available in your application!
266  IMGUI_API void ShowAboutWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create About window. display Dear ImGui version, credits and build/system information.
267  IMGUI_API void ShowMetricsWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create Debug/Metrics window. display Dear ImGui internals: draw commands (with individual draw calls and vertices), window list, basic internal state, etc.
268  IMGUI_API void ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle* ref = NULL); // add style editor block (not a window). you can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure to compare to, revert to and save to (else it uses the default style)
269  IMGUI_API bool ShowStyleSelector(const char* label); // add style selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the default styles.
270  IMGUI_API void ShowFontSelector(const char* label); // add font selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the loaded fonts.
271  IMGUI_API void ShowUserGuide(); // add basic help/info block (not a window): how to manipulate ImGui as a end-user (mouse/keyboard controls).
272  IMGUI_API const char* GetVersion(); // get the compiled version string e.g. "1.23" (essentially the compiled value for IMGUI_VERSION)
273 
274  // Styles
275  IMGUI_API void StyleColorsDark(ImGuiStyle* dst = NULL); // new, recommended style (default)
276  IMGUI_API void StyleColorsClassic(ImGuiStyle* dst = NULL); // classic imgui style
277  IMGUI_API void StyleColorsLight(ImGuiStyle* dst = NULL); // best used with borders and a custom, thicker font
278 
279  // Windows
280  // - Begin() = push window to the stack and start appending to it. End() = pop window from the stack.
281  // - You may append multiple times to the same window during the same frame.
282  // - Passing 'bool* p_open != NULL' shows a window-closing widget in the upper-right corner of the window,
283  // which clicking will set the boolean to false when clicked.
284  // - Begin() return false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting
285  // anything to the window. Always call a matching End() for each Begin() call, regardless of its return value!
286  // [Important: due to legacy reason, this is inconsistent with most other functions such as BeginMenu/EndMenu,
287  // BeginPopup/EndPopup, etc. where the EndXXX call should only be called if the corresponding BeginXXX function
288  // returned true. Begin and BeginChild are the only odd ones out. Will be fixed in a future update.]
289  // - Note that the bottom of window stack always contains a window called "Debug".
290  IMGUI_API bool Begin(const char* name, bool* p_open = NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0);
291  IMGUI_API void End();
292 
293  // Child Windows
294  // - Use child windows to begin into a self-contained independent scrolling/clipping regions within a host window. Child windows can embed their own child.
295  // - For each independent axis of 'size': ==0.0f: use remaining host window size / >0.0f: fixed size / <0.0f: use remaining window size minus abs(size) / Each axis can use a different mode, e.g. ImVec2(0,400).
296  // - BeginChild() returns false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting anything to the window.
297  // Always call a matching EndChild() for each BeginChild() call, regardless of its return value [as with Begin: this is due to legacy reason and inconsistent with most BeginXXX functions apart from the regular Begin() which behaves like BeginChild().]
298  IMGUI_API bool BeginChild(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0), bool border = false, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0);
299  IMGUI_API bool BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0), bool border = false, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0);
300  IMGUI_API void EndChild();
301 
302  // Windows Utilities
303  // - 'current window' = the window we are appending into while inside a Begin()/End() block. 'next window' = next window we will Begin() into.
304  IMGUI_API bool IsWindowAppearing();
305  IMGUI_API bool IsWindowCollapsed();
306  IMGUI_API bool IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags=0); // is current window focused? or its root/child, depending on flags. see flags for options.
307  IMGUI_API bool IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags=0); // is current window hovered (and typically: not blocked by a popup/modal)? see flags for options. NB: If you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to imgui or to your app, you should use the 'io.WantCaptureMouse' boolean for that! Please read the FAQ!
308  IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetWindowDrawList(); // get draw list associated to the current window, to append your own drawing primitives
309  IMGUI_API float GetWindowDpiScale(); // get DPI scale currently associated to the current window's viewport.
310  IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport*GetWindowViewport(); // get viewport currently associated to the current window.
311  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowPos(); // get current window position in screen space (useful if you want to do your own drawing via the DrawList API)
312  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowSize(); // get current window size
313  IMGUI_API float GetWindowWidth(); // get current window width (shortcut for GetWindowSize().x)
314  IMGUI_API float GetWindowHeight(); // get current window height (shortcut for GetWindowSize().y)
315 
316  // Prefer using SetNextXXX functions (before Begin) rather that SetXXX functions (after Begin).
317  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0, const ImVec2& pivot = ImVec2(0,0)); // set next window position. call before Begin(). use pivot=(0.5f,0.5f) to center on given point, etc.
318  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis. call before Begin()
319  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(const ImVec2& size_min, const ImVec2& size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback = NULL, void* custom_callback_data = NULL); // set next window size limits. use -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the current size. Sizes will be rounded down. Use callback to apply non-trivial programmatic constraints.
320  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowContentSize(const ImVec2& size); // set next window content size (~ scrollable client area, which enforce the range of scrollbars). Not including window decorations (title bar, menu bar, etc.) nor WindowPadding. set an axis to 0.0f to leave it automatic. call before Begin()
321  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window collapsed state. call before Begin()
322  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowFocus(); // set next window to be focused / top-most. call before Begin()
323  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowBgAlpha(float alpha); // set next window background color alpha. helper to easily override the Alpha component of ImGuiCol_WindowBg/ChildBg/PopupBg. you may also use ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground.
324  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowViewport(ImGuiID viewport_id); // set next window viewport
325  IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window position - call within Begin()/End(). prefer using SetNextWindowPos(), as this may incur tearing and side-effects.
326  IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window size - call within Begin()/End(). set to ImVec2(0,0) to force an auto-fit. prefer using SetNextWindowSize(), as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects.
327  IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window collapsed state. prefer using SetNextWindowCollapsed().
328  IMGUI_API void SetWindowFocus(); // (not recommended) set current window to be focused / top-most. prefer using SetNextWindowFocus().
329  IMGUI_API void SetWindowFontScale(float scale); // set font scale. Adjust IO.FontGlobalScale if you want to scale all windows. This is an old API! For correct scaling, prefer to reload font + rebuild ImFontAtlas + call style.ScaleAllSizes().
330  IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(const char* name, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window position.
331  IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(const char* name, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis.
332  IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(const char* name, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window collapsed state
333  IMGUI_API void SetWindowFocus(const char* name); // set named window to be focused / top-most. use NULL to remove focus.
334 
335  // Content region
336  // - Those functions are bound to be redesigned soon (they are confusing, incomplete and return values in local window coordinates which increases confusion)
337  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetContentRegionMax(); // current content boundaries (typically window boundaries including scrolling, or current column boundaries), in windows coordinates
338  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetContentRegionAvail(); // == GetContentRegionMax() - GetCursorPos()
339  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowContentRegionMin(); // content boundaries min (roughly (0,0)-Scroll), in window coordinates
340  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowContentRegionMax(); // content boundaries max (roughly (0,0)+Size-Scroll) where Size can be override with SetNextWindowContentSize(), in window coordinates
341  IMGUI_API float GetWindowContentRegionWidth(); //
342 
343  // Windows Scrolling
344  IMGUI_API float GetScrollX(); // get scrolling amount [0..GetScrollMaxX()]
345  IMGUI_API float GetScrollY(); // get scrolling amount [0..GetScrollMaxY()]
346  IMGUI_API float GetScrollMaxX(); // get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.X - WindowSize.X
347  IMGUI_API float GetScrollMaxY(); // get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.Y - WindowSize.Y
348  IMGUI_API void SetScrollX(float scroll_x); // set scrolling amount [0..GetScrollMaxX()]
349  IMGUI_API void SetScrollY(float scroll_y); // set scrolling amount [0..GetScrollMaxY()]
350  IMGUI_API void SetScrollHereX(float center_x_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible. center_x_ratio=0.0: left, 0.5: center, 1.0: right. When using to make a "default/current item" visible, consider using SetItemDefaultFocus() instead.
351  IMGUI_API void SetScrollHereY(float center_y_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible. center_y_ratio=0.0: top, 0.5: center, 1.0: bottom. When using to make a "default/current item" visible, consider using SetItemDefaultFocus() instead.
352  IMGUI_API void SetScrollFromPosX(float local_x, float center_x_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible. Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.
353  IMGUI_API void SetScrollFromPosY(float local_y, float center_y_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible. Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.
354 
355  // Parameters stacks (shared)
356  IMGUI_API void PushFont(ImFont* font); // use NULL as a shortcut to push default font
357  IMGUI_API void PopFont();
358  IMGUI_API void PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, ImU32 col);
359  IMGUI_API void PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, const ImVec4& col);
360  IMGUI_API void PopStyleColor(int count = 1);
361  IMGUI_API void PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float val);
362  IMGUI_API void PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, const ImVec2& val);
363  IMGUI_API void PopStyleVar(int count = 1);
364  IMGUI_API const ImVec4& GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol idx); // retrieve style color as stored in ImGuiStyle structure. use to feed back into PushStyleColor(), otherwise use GetColorU32() to get style color with style alpha baked in.
365  IMGUI_API ImFont* GetFont(); // get current font
366  IMGUI_API float GetFontSize(); // get current font size (= height in pixels) of current font with current scale applied
367  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetFontTexUvWhitePixel(); // get UV coordinate for a while pixel, useful to draw custom shapes via the ImDrawList API
368  IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(ImGuiCol idx, float alpha_mul = 1.0f); // retrieve given style color with style alpha applied and optional extra alpha multiplier
369  IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(const ImVec4& col); // retrieve given color with style alpha applied
370  IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(ImU32 col); // retrieve given color with style alpha applied
371 
372  // Parameters stacks (current window)
373  IMGUI_API void PushItemWidth(float item_width); // push width of items for common large "item+label" widgets. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align xx pixels to the right of window (so -1.0f always align width to the right side). 0.0f = default to ~2/3 of windows width,
374  IMGUI_API void PopItemWidth();
375  IMGUI_API void SetNextItemWidth(float item_width); // set width of the _next_ common large "item+label" widget. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align xx pixels to the right of window (so -1.0f always align width to the right side)
376  IMGUI_API float CalcItemWidth(); // width of item given pushed settings and current cursor position. NOT necessarily the width of last item unlike most 'Item' functions.
377  IMGUI_API void PushTextWrapPos(float wrap_local_pos_x = 0.0f); // push word-wrapping position for Text*() commands. < 0.0f: no wrapping; 0.0f: wrap to end of window (or column); > 0.0f: wrap at 'wrap_pos_x' position in window local space
378  IMGUI_API void PopTextWrapPos();
379  IMGUI_API void PushAllowKeyboardFocus(bool allow_keyboard_focus); // allow focusing using TAB/Shift-TAB, enabled by default but you can disable it for certain widgets
380  IMGUI_API void PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
381  IMGUI_API void PushButtonRepeat(bool repeat); // in 'repeat' mode, Button*() functions return repeated true in a typematic manner (using io.KeyRepeatDelay/io.KeyRepeatRate setting). Note that you can call IsItemActive() after any Button() to tell if the button is held in the current frame.
382  IMGUI_API void PopButtonRepeat();
383 
384  // Cursor / Layout
385  // - By "cursor" we mean the current output position.
386  // - The typical widget behavior is to output themselves at the current cursor position, then move the cursor one line down.
387  // - You can call SameLine() between widgets to undo the last carriage return and output at the right of the preceding widget.
388  // - Attention! We currently have inconsistencies between window-local and absolute positions we will aim to fix with future API:
389  // Window-local coordinates: SameLine(), GetCursorPos(), SetCursorPos(), GetCursorStartPos(), GetContentRegionMax(), GetWindowContentRegion*(), PushTextWrapPos()
390  // Absolute coordinate: GetCursorScreenPos(), SetCursorScreenPos(), all ImDrawList:: functions.
391  IMGUI_API void Separator(); // separator, generally horizontal. inside a menu bar or in horizontal layout mode, this becomes a vertical separator.
392  IMGUI_API void SameLine(float offset_from_start_x=0.0f, float spacing=-1.0f); // call between widgets or groups to layout them horizontally. X position given in window coordinates.
393  IMGUI_API void NewLine(); // undo a SameLine() or force a new line when in an horizontal-layout context.
394  IMGUI_API void Spacing(); // add vertical spacing.
395  IMGUI_API void Dummy(const ImVec2& size); // add a dummy item of given size. unlike InvisibleButton(), Dummy() won't take the mouse click or be navigable into.
396  IMGUI_API void Indent(float indent_w = 0.0f); // move content position toward the right, by style.IndentSpacing or indent_w if != 0
397  IMGUI_API void Unindent(float indent_w = 0.0f); // move content position back to the left, by style.IndentSpacing or indent_w if != 0
398  IMGUI_API void BeginGroup(); // lock horizontal starting position
399  IMGUI_API void EndGroup(); // unlock horizontal starting position + capture the whole group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.)
400  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorPos(); // cursor position in window coordinates (relative to window position)
401  IMGUI_API float GetCursorPosX(); // (some functions are using window-relative coordinates, such as: GetCursorPos, GetCursorStartPos, GetContentRegionMax, GetWindowContentRegion* etc.
402  IMGUI_API float GetCursorPosY(); // other functions such as GetCursorScreenPos or everything in ImDrawList::
403  IMGUI_API void SetCursorPos(const ImVec2& local_pos); // are using the main, absolute coordinate system.
404  IMGUI_API void SetCursorPosX(float local_x); // GetWindowPos() + GetCursorPos() == GetCursorScreenPos() etc.)
405  IMGUI_API void SetCursorPosY(float local_y); //
406  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorStartPos(); // initial cursor position in window coordinates
407  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorScreenPos(); // cursor position in absolute screen coordinates (0..io.DisplaySize) or natural OS coordinates when using multiple viewport. Useful to work with ImDrawList API.
408  IMGUI_API void SetCursorScreenPos(const ImVec2& pos); // cursor position in absolute screen coordinates (0..io.DisplaySize) or natural OS coordinates when using multiple viewport.
409  IMGUI_API void AlignTextToFramePadding(); // vertically align upcoming text baseline to FramePadding.y so that it will align properly to regularly framed items (call if you have text on a line before a framed item)
410  IMGUI_API float GetTextLineHeight(); // ~ FontSize
411  IMGUI_API float GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing(); // ~ FontSize + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of text)
412  IMGUI_API float GetFrameHeight(); // ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2
413  IMGUI_API float GetFrameHeightWithSpacing(); // ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2 + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of framed widgets)
414 
415  // ID stack/scopes
416  // - Read the FAQ for more details about how ID are handled in dear imgui. If you are creating widgets in a loop you most
417  // likely want to push a unique identifier (e.g. object pointer, loop index) to uniquely differentiate them.
418  // - The resulting ID are hashes of the entire stack.
419  // - You can also use the "Label##foobar" syntax within widget label to distinguish them from each others.
420  // - In this header file we use the "label"/"name" terminology to denote a string that will be displayed and used as an ID,
421  // whereas "str_id" denote a string that is only used as an ID and not normally displayed.
422  IMGUI_API void PushID(const char* str_id); // push string into the ID stack (will hash string).
423  IMGUI_API void PushID(const char* str_id_begin, const char* str_id_end); // push string into the ID stack (will hash string).
424  IMGUI_API void PushID(const void* ptr_id); // push pointer into the ID stack (will hash pointer).
425  IMGUI_API void PushID(int int_id); // push integer into the ID stack (will hash integer).
426  IMGUI_API void PopID(); // pop from the ID stack.
427  IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const char* str_id); // calculate unique ID (hash of whole ID stack + given parameter). e.g. if you want to query into ImGuiStorage yourself
428  IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const char* str_id_begin, const char* str_id_end);
429  IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const void* ptr_id);
430 
431  // Widgets: Text
432  IMGUI_API void TextUnformatted(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL); // raw text without formatting. Roughly equivalent to Text("%s", text) but: A) doesn't require null terminated string if 'text_end' is specified, B) it's faster, no memory copy is done, no buffer size limits, recommended for long chunks of text.
433  IMGUI_API void Text(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // formatted text
434  IMGUI_API void TextV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
435  IMGUI_API void TextColored(const ImVec4& col, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, col); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor();
436  IMGUI_API void TextColoredV(const ImVec4& col, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
437  IMGUI_API void TextDisabled(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor();
438  IMGUI_API void TextDisabledV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
439  IMGUI_API void TextWrapped(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for PushTextWrapPos(0.0f); Text(fmt, ...); PopTextWrapPos();. Note that this won't work on an auto-resizing window if there's no other widgets to extend the window width, yoy may need to set a size using SetNextWindowSize().
440  IMGUI_API void TextWrappedV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
441  IMGUI_API void LabelText(const char* label, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // display text+label aligned the same way as value+label widgets
442  IMGUI_API void LabelTextV(const char* label, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
443  IMGUI_API void BulletText(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for Bullet()+Text()
444  IMGUI_API void BulletTextV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
445 
446  // Widgets: Main
447  // - Most widgets return true when the value has been changed or when pressed/selected
448  // - You may also use one of the many IsItemXXX functions (e.g. IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.) to query widget state.
449  IMGUI_API bool Button(const char* label, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0)); // button
450  IMGUI_API bool SmallButton(const char* label); // button with FramePadding=(0,0) to easily embed within text
451  IMGUI_API bool InvisibleButton(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size); // button behavior without the visuals, frequently useful to build custom behaviors using the public api (along with IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.)
452  IMGUI_API bool ArrowButton(const char* str_id, ImGuiDir dir); // square button with an arrow shape
453  IMGUI_API void Image(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& size, const ImVec2& uv0 = ImVec2(0,0), const ImVec2& uv1 = ImVec2(1,1), const ImVec4& tint_col = ImVec4(1,1,1,1), const ImVec4& border_col = ImVec4(0,0,0,0));
454  IMGUI_API bool ImageButton(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& size, const ImVec2& uv0 = ImVec2(0,0), const ImVec2& uv1 = ImVec2(1,1), int frame_padding = -1, const ImVec4& bg_col = ImVec4(0,0,0,0), const ImVec4& tint_col = ImVec4(1,1,1,1)); // <0 frame_padding uses default frame padding settings. 0 for no padding
455  IMGUI_API bool Checkbox(const char* label, bool* v);
456  IMGUI_API bool CheckboxFlags(const char* label, unsigned int* flags, unsigned int flags_value);
457  IMGUI_API bool RadioButton(const char* label, bool active); // use with e.g. if (RadioButton("one", my_value==1)) { my_value = 1; }
458  IMGUI_API bool RadioButton(const char* label, int* v, int v_button); // shortcut to handle the above pattern when value is an integer
459  IMGUI_API void ProgressBar(float fraction, const ImVec2& size_arg = ImVec2(-1,0), const char* overlay = NULL);
460  IMGUI_API void Bullet(); // draw a small circle and keep the cursor on the same line. advance cursor x position by GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(), same distance that TreeNode() uses
461 
462  // Widgets: Combo Box
463  // - The BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api allows you to manage your contents and selection state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable() items.
464  // - The old Combo() api are helpers over BeginCombo()/EndCombo() which are kept available for convenience purpose.
465  IMGUI_API bool BeginCombo(const char* label, const char* preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags flags = 0);
466  IMGUI_API void EndCombo(); // only call EndCombo() if BeginCombo() returns true!
467  IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1);
468  IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* items_separated_by_zeros, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1); // Separate items with \0 within a string, end item-list with \0\0. e.g. "One\0Two\0Three\0"
469  IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, bool(*items_getter)(void* data, int idx, const char** out_text), void* data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1);
470 
471  // Widgets: Drags
472  // - CTRL+Click on any drag box to turn them into an input box. Manually input values aren't clamped and can go off-bounds.
473  // - For all the Float2/Float3/Float4/Int2/Int3/Int4 versions of every functions, note that a 'float v[X]' function argument is the same as 'float* v', the array syntax is just a way to document the number of elements that are expected to be accessible. You can pass address of your first element out of a contiguous set, e.g. &myvector.x
474  // - Adjust format string to decorate the value with a prefix, a suffix, or adapt the editing and display precision e.g. "%.3f" -> 1.234; "%5.2f secs" -> 01.23 secs; "Biscuit: %.0f" -> Biscuit: 1; etc.
475  // - Speed are per-pixel of mouse movement (v_speed=0.2f: mouse needs to move by 5 pixels to increase value by 1). For gamepad/keyboard navigation, minimum speed is Max(v_speed, minimum_step_at_given_precision).
476  // - Use v_min < v_max to clamp edits to given limits. Note that CTRL+Click manual input can override those limits.
477  // - Use v_max = FLT_MAX / INT_MAX etc to avoid clamping to a maximum, same with v_min = -FLT_MAX / INT_MIN to avoid clamping to a minimum.
478  // - Use v_min > v_max to lock edits.
479  IMGUI_API bool DragFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f); // If v_min >= v_max we have no bound
480  IMGUI_API bool DragFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
481  IMGUI_API bool DragFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
482  IMGUI_API bool DragFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
483  IMGUI_API bool DragFloatRange2(const char* label, float* v_current_min, float* v_current_max, float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", const char* format_max = NULL, float power = 1.0f);
484  IMGUI_API bool DragInt(const char* label, int* v, float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0, const char* format = "%d"); // If v_min >= v_max we have no bound
485  IMGUI_API bool DragInt2(const char* label, int v[2], float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0, const char* format = "%d");
486  IMGUI_API bool DragInt3(const char* label, int v[3], float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0, const char* format = "%d");
487  IMGUI_API bool DragInt4(const char* label, int v[4], float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0, const char* format = "%d");
488  IMGUI_API bool DragIntRange2(const char* label, int* v_current_min, int* v_current_max, float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0, const char* format = "%d", const char* format_max = NULL);
489  IMGUI_API bool DragScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, float v_speed, const void* p_min = NULL, const void* p_max = NULL, const char* format = NULL, float power = 1.0f);
490  IMGUI_API bool DragScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, float v_speed, const void* p_min = NULL, const void* p_max = NULL, const char* format = NULL, float power = 1.0f);
491 
492  // Widgets: Sliders
493  // - CTRL+Click on any slider to turn them into an input box. Manually input values aren't clamped and can go off-bounds.
494  // - Adjust format string to decorate the value with a prefix, a suffix, or adapt the editing and display precision e.g. "%.3f" -> 1.234; "%5.2f secs" -> 01.23 secs; "Biscuit: %.0f" -> Biscuit: 1; etc.
495  IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f); // adjust format to decorate the value with a prefix or a suffix for in-slider labels or unit display. Use power!=1.0 for power curve sliders
496  IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
497  IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
498  IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
499  IMGUI_API bool SliderAngle(const char* label, float* v_rad, float v_degrees_min = -360.0f, float v_degrees_max = +360.0f, const char* format = "%.0f deg");
500  IMGUI_API bool SliderInt(const char* label, int* v, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format = "%d");
501  IMGUI_API bool SliderInt2(const char* label, int v[2], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format = "%d");
502  IMGUI_API bool SliderInt3(const char* label, int v[3], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format = "%d");
503  IMGUI_API bool SliderInt4(const char* label, int v[4], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format = "%d");
504  IMGUI_API bool SliderScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format = NULL, float power = 1.0f);
505  IMGUI_API bool SliderScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format = NULL, float power = 1.0f);
506  IMGUI_API bool VSliderFloat(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format = "%.3f", float power = 1.0f);
507  IMGUI_API bool VSliderInt(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, int* v, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format = "%d");
508  IMGUI_API bool VSliderScalar(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format = NULL, float power = 1.0f);
509 
510  // Widgets: Input with Keyboard
511  // - If you want to use InputText() with std::string or any custom dynamic string type, see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h and comments in imgui_demo.cpp.
512  // - Most of the ImGuiInputTextFlags flags are only useful for InputText() and not for InputFloatX, InputIntX, InputDouble etc.
513  IMGUI_API bool InputText(const char* label, char* buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback = NULL, void* user_data = NULL);
514  IMGUI_API bool InputTextMultiline(const char* label, char* buf, size_t buf_size, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0), ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback = NULL, void* user_data = NULL);
515  IMGUI_API bool InputTextWithHint(const char* label, const char* hint, char* buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback = NULL, void* user_data = NULL);
516  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat(const char* label, float* v, float step = 0.0f, float step_fast = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
517  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], const char* format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
518  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], const char* format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
519  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], const char* format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
520  IMGUI_API bool InputInt(const char* label, int* v, int step = 1, int step_fast = 100, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
521  IMGUI_API bool InputInt2(const char* label, int v[2], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
522  IMGUI_API bool InputInt3(const char* label, int v[3], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
523  IMGUI_API bool InputInt4(const char* label, int v[4], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
524  IMGUI_API bool InputDouble(const char* label, double* v, double step = 0.0, double step_fast = 0.0, const char* format = "%.6f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
525  IMGUI_API bool InputScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_step = NULL, const void* p_step_fast = NULL, const char* format = NULL, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
526  IMGUI_API bool InputScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, const void* p_step = NULL, const void* p_step_fast = NULL, const char* format = NULL, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
527 
528  // Widgets: Color Editor/Picker (tip: the ColorEdit* functions have a little colored preview square that can be left-clicked to open a picker, and right-clicked to open an option menu.)
529  // - Note that in C++ a 'float v[X]' function argument is the _same_ as 'float* v', the array syntax is just a way to document the number of elements that are expected to be accessible.
530  // - You can pass the address of a first float element out of a contiguous structure, e.g. &myvector.x
531  IMGUI_API bool ColorEdit3(const char* label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0);
532  IMGUI_API bool ColorEdit4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0);
533  IMGUI_API bool ColorPicker3(const char* label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0);
534  IMGUI_API bool ColorPicker4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0, const float* ref_col = NULL);
535  IMGUI_API bool ColorButton(const char* desc_id, const ImVec4& col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0, ImVec2 size = ImVec2(0,0)); // display a colored square/button, hover for details, return true when pressed.
536  IMGUI_API void SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags flags); // initialize current options (generally on application startup) if you want to select a default format, picker type, etc. User will be able to change many settings, unless you pass the _NoOptions flag to your calls.
537 
538  // Widgets: Trees
539  // - TreeNode functions return true when the node is open, in which case you need to also call TreePop() when you are finished displaying the tree node contents.
540  IMGUI_API bool TreeNode(const char* label);
541  IMGUI_API bool TreeNode(const char* str_id, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // helper variation to easily decorelate the id from the displayed string. Read the FAQ about why and how to use ID. to align arbitrary text at the same level as a TreeNode() you can use Bullet().
542  IMGUI_API bool TreeNode(const void* ptr_id, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // "
543  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeV(const char* str_id, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
544  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeV(const void* ptr_id, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
545  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeEx(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0);
546  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeEx(const char* str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(3);
547  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeEx(const void* ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(3);
548  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeExV(const char* str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(3);
549  IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeExV(const void* ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(3);
550  IMGUI_API void TreePush(const char* str_id); // ~ Indent()+PushId(). Already called by TreeNode() when returning true, but you can call TreePush/TreePop yourself if desired.
551  IMGUI_API void TreePush(const void* ptr_id = NULL); // "
552  IMGUI_API void TreePop(); // ~ Unindent()+PopId()
553  IMGUI_API float GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(); // horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode*() or Bullet() == (g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x*2) for a regular unframed TreeNode
554  IMGUI_API bool CollapsingHeader(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0); // if returning 'true' the header is open. doesn't indent nor push on ID stack. user doesn't have to call TreePop().
555  IMGUI_API bool CollapsingHeader(const char* label, bool* p_open, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0); // when 'p_open' isn't NULL, display an additional small close button on upper right of the header
556  IMGUI_API void SetNextItemOpen(bool is_open, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state.
557 
558  // Widgets: Selectables
559  // - A selectable highlights when hovered, and can display another color when selected.
560  // - Neighbors selectable extend their highlight bounds in order to leave no gap between them. This is so a series of selected Selectable appear contiguous.
561  IMGUI_API bool Selectable(const char* label, bool selected = false, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = 0, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0)); // "bool selected" carry the selection state (read-only). Selectable() is clicked is returns true so you can modify your selection state. size.x==0.0: use remaining width, size.x>0.0: specify width. size.y==0.0: use label height, size.y>0.0: specify height
562  IMGUI_API bool Selectable(const char* label, bool* p_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = 0, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0)); // "bool* p_selected" point to the selection state (read-write), as a convenient helper.
563 
564  // Widgets: List Boxes
565  // - FIXME: To be consistent with all the newer API, ListBoxHeader/ListBoxFooter should in reality be called BeginListBox/EndListBox. Will rename them.
566  IMGUI_API bool ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int height_in_items = -1);
567  IMGUI_API bool ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, bool (*items_getter)(void* data, int idx, const char** out_text), void* data, int items_count, int height_in_items = -1);
568  IMGUI_API bool ListBoxHeader(const char* label, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0,0)); // use if you want to reimplement ListBox() will custom data or interactions. if the function return true, you can output elements then call ListBoxFooter() afterwards.
569  IMGUI_API bool ListBoxHeader(const char* label, int items_count, int height_in_items = -1); // "
570  IMGUI_API void ListBoxFooter(); // terminate the scrolling region. only call ListBoxFooter() if ListBoxHeader() returned true!
571 
572  // Widgets: Data Plotting
573  IMGUI_API void PlotLines(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0), int stride = sizeof(float));
574  IMGUI_API void PlotLines(const char* label, float(*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0));
575  IMGUI_API void PlotHistogram(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0), int stride = sizeof(float));
576  IMGUI_API void PlotHistogram(const char* label, float(*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0));
577 
578  // Widgets: Value() Helpers.
579  // - Those are merely shortcut to calling Text() with a format string. Output single value in "name: value" format (tip: freely declare more in your code to handle your types. you can add functions to the ImGui namespace)
580  IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, bool b);
581  IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, int v);
582  IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, unsigned int v);
583  IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, float v, const char* float_format = NULL);
584 
585  // Widgets: Menus
586  // - Use BeginMenuBar() on a window ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar to append to its menu bar.
587  // - Use BeginMainMenuBar() to create a menu bar at the top of the screen and append to it.
588  // - Use BeginMenu() to create a menu. You can call BeginMenu() multiple time with the same identifier to append more items to it.
589  IMGUI_API bool BeginMenuBar(); // append to menu-bar of current window (requires ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar flag set on parent window).
590  IMGUI_API void EndMenuBar(); // only call EndMenuBar() if BeginMenuBar() returns true!
591  IMGUI_API bool BeginMainMenuBar(); // create and append to a full screen menu-bar.
592  IMGUI_API void EndMainMenuBar(); // only call EndMainMenuBar() if BeginMainMenuBar() returns true!
593  IMGUI_API bool BeginMenu(const char* label, bool enabled = true); // create a sub-menu entry. only call EndMenu() if this returns true!
594  IMGUI_API void EndMenu(); // only call EndMenu() if BeginMenu() returns true!
595  IMGUI_API bool MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut = NULL, bool selected = false, bool enabled = true); // return true when activated. shortcuts are displayed for convenience but not processed by ImGui at the moment
596  IMGUI_API bool MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut, bool* p_selected, bool enabled = true); // return true when activated + toggle (*p_selected) if p_selected != NULL
597 
598  // Tooltips
599  // - Tooltip are windows following the mouse which do not take focus away.
600  IMGUI_API void BeginTooltip(); // begin/append a tooltip window. to create full-featured tooltip (with any kind of items).
601  IMGUI_API void EndTooltip();
602  IMGUI_API void SetTooltip(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // set a text-only tooltip, typically use with ImGui::IsItemHovered(). override any previous call to SetTooltip().
603  IMGUI_API void SetTooltipV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
604 
605  // Popups, Modals
606  // The properties of popups windows are:
607  // - They block normal mouse hovering detection outside them. (*1)
608  // - Unless modal, they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
609  // Because hovering detection is disabled outside the popup, when clicking outside the click will not be seen by underlying widgets! (*1)
610  // - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally by Dear ImGui instead of being held by the programmer as we are used to with regular Begin() calls.
611  // User can manipulate the visibility state by calling OpenPopup(), CloseCurrentPopup() etc.
612  // - We default to use the right mouse (ImGuiMouseButton_Right=1) for the Popup Context functions.
613  // Those three properties are connected: we need to retain popup visibility state in the library because popups may be closed as any time.
614  // (*1) You can bypass that restriction and detect hovering even when normally blocked by a popup.
615  // To do this use the ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup when calling IsItemHovered() or IsWindowHovered().
616  // This is what BeginPopupContextItem() and BeginPopupContextWindow() are doing already, allowing a right-click to reopen another popups without losing the click.
617  IMGUI_API void OpenPopup(const char* str_id); // call to mark popup as open (don't call every frame!). popups are closed when user click outside, or if CloseCurrentPopup() is called within a BeginPopup()/EndPopup() block. By default, Selectable()/MenuItem() are calling CloseCurrentPopup(). Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID-stack (so OpenPopup and BeginPopup needs to be at the same level).
618  IMGUI_API bool BeginPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // return true if the popup is open, and you can start outputting to it. only call EndPopup() if BeginPopup() returns true!
619  IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextItem(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = 1); // helper to open and begin popup when clicked on last item. if you can pass a NULL str_id only if the previous item had an id. If you want to use that on a non-interactive item such as Text() you need to pass in an explicit ID here. read comments in .cpp!
620  IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = 1, bool also_over_items = true); // helper to open and begin popup when clicked on current window.
621  IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextVoid(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = 1); // helper to open and begin popup when clicked in void (where there are no imgui windows).
622  IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupModal(const char* name, bool* p_open = NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // modal dialog (regular window with title bar, block interactions behind the modal window, can't close the modal window by clicking outside)
623  IMGUI_API void EndPopup(); // only call EndPopup() if BeginPopupXXX() returns true!
624  IMGUI_API bool OpenPopupOnItemClick(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = 1); // helper to open popup when clicked on last item (note: actually triggers on the mouse _released_ event to be consistent with popup behaviors). return true when just opened.
625  IMGUI_API bool IsPopupOpen(const char* str_id); // return true if the popup is open at the current begin-ed level of the popup stack.
626  IMGUI_API void CloseCurrentPopup(); // close the popup we have begin-ed into. clicking on a MenuItem or Selectable automatically close the current popup.
627 
628  // Columns
629  // - You can also use SameLine(pos_x) to mimic simplified columns.
630  // - The columns API is work-in-progress and rather lacking (columns are arguably the worst part of dear imgui at the moment!)
631  // - There is a maximum of 64 columns.
632  // - Currently working on new 'Tables' api which will replace columns around Q2 2020 (see GitHub #2957).
633  IMGUI_API void Columns(int count = 1, const char* id = NULL, bool border = true);
634  IMGUI_API void NextColumn(); // next column, defaults to current row or next row if the current row is finished
635  IMGUI_API int GetColumnIndex(); // get current column index
636  IMGUI_API float GetColumnWidth(int column_index = -1); // get column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column
637  IMGUI_API void SetColumnWidth(int column_index, float width); // set column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column
638  IMGUI_API float GetColumnOffset(int column_index = -1); // get position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use current column, otherwise 0..GetColumnsCount() inclusive. column 0 is typically 0.0f
639  IMGUI_API void SetColumnOffset(int column_index, float offset_x); // set position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use current column
640  IMGUI_API int GetColumnsCount();
641 
642  // Tab Bars, Tabs
643  // Note: Tabs are automatically created by the docking system. Use this to create tab bars/tabs yourself without docking being involved.
644  IMGUI_API bool BeginTabBar(const char* str_id, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags = 0); // create and append into a TabBar
645  IMGUI_API void EndTabBar(); // only call EndTabBar() if BeginTabBar() returns true!
646  IMGUI_API bool BeginTabItem(const char* label, bool* p_open = NULL, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags = 0);// create a Tab. Returns true if the Tab is selected.
647  IMGUI_API void EndTabItem(); // only call EndTabItem() if BeginTabItem() returns true!
648  IMGUI_API void SetTabItemClosed(const char* tab_or_docked_window_label); // notify TabBar or Docking system of a closed tab/window ahead (useful to reduce visual flicker on reorderable tab bars). For tab-bar: call after BeginTabBar() and before Tab submissions. Otherwise call with a window name.
649 
650  // Docking
651  // [BETA API] Enable with io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable.
652  // Note: You can use most Docking facilities without calling any API. You DO NOT need to call DockSpace() to use Docking!
653  // - To dock windows: if io.ConfigDockingWithShift == false (default) drag window from their title bar.
654  // - To dock windows: if io.ConfigDockingWithShift == true: hold SHIFT anywhere while moving windows.
655  // About DockSpace:
656  // - Use DockSpace() to create an explicit dock node _within_ an existing window. See Docking demo for details.
657  // - DockSpace() needs to be submitted _before_ any window they can host. If you use a dockspace, submit it early in your app.
658  IMGUI_API void DockSpace(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class = NULL);
659  IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpaceOverViewport(ImGuiViewport* viewport = NULL, ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class = NULL);
660  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowDockID(ImGuiID dock_id, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window dock id (FIXME-DOCK)
661  IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowClass(const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class); // set next window class (rare/advanced uses: provide hints to the platform back-end via altered viewport flags and parent/child info)
662  IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetWindowDockID();
663  IMGUI_API bool IsWindowDocked(); // is current window docked into another window?
664 
665  // Logging/Capture
666  // - All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard. By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
667  IMGUI_API void LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth = -1); // start logging to tty (stdout)
668  IMGUI_API void LogToFile(int auto_open_depth = -1, const char* filename = NULL); // start logging to file
669  IMGUI_API void LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth = -1); // start logging to OS clipboard
670  IMGUI_API void LogFinish(); // stop logging (close file, etc.)
671  IMGUI_API void LogButtons(); // helper to display buttons for logging to tty/file/clipboard
672  IMGUI_API void LogText(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
673 
674  // Drag and Drop
675  // - [BETA API] API may evolve!
676  // - If you stop calling BeginDragDropSource() the payload is preserved however it won't have a preview tooltip (we currently display a fallback "..." tooltip as replacement)
677  IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // call when the current item is active. If this return true, you can call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource()
678  IMGUI_API bool SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t sz, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // type is a user defined string of maximum 32 characters. Strings starting with '_' are reserved for dear imgui internal types. Data is copied and held by imgui.
679  IMGUI_API void EndDragDropSource(); // only call EndDragDropSource() if BeginDragDropSource() returns true!
680  IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropTarget(); // call after submitting an item that may receive a payload. If this returns true, you can call AcceptDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropTarget()
681  IMGUI_API const ImGuiPayload* AcceptDragDropPayload(const char* type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // accept contents of a given type. If ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery is set you can peek into the payload before the mouse button is released.
682  IMGUI_API void EndDragDropTarget(); // only call EndDragDropTarget() if BeginDragDropTarget() returns true!
683  IMGUI_API const ImGuiPayload* GetDragDropPayload(); // peek directly into the current payload from anywhere. may return NULL. use ImGuiPayload::IsDataType() to test for the payload type.
684 
685  // Clipping
686  IMGUI_API void PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
687  IMGUI_API void PopClipRect();
688 
689  // Focus, Activation
690  // - Prefer using "SetItemDefaultFocus()" over "if (IsWindowAppearing()) SetScrollHereY()" when applicable to signify "this is the default item"
691  IMGUI_API void SetItemDefaultFocus(); // make last item the default focused item of a window.
692  IMGUI_API void SetKeyboardFocusHere(int offset = 0); // focus keyboard on the next widget. Use positive 'offset' to access sub components of a multiple component widget. Use -1 to access previous widget.
693 
694  // Item/Widgets Utilities
695  // - Most of the functions are referring to the last/previous item we submitted.
696  // - See Demo Window under "Widgets->Querying Status" for an interactive visualization of most of those functions.
697  IMGUI_API bool IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags = 0); // is the last item hovered? (and usable, aka not blocked by a popup, etc.). See ImGuiHoveredFlags for more options.
698  IMGUI_API bool IsItemActive(); // is the last item active? (e.g. button being held, text field being edited. This will continuously return true while holding mouse button on an item. Items that don't interact will always return false)
699  IMGUI_API bool IsItemFocused(); // is the last item focused for keyboard/gamepad navigation?
700  IMGUI_API bool IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = 0); // is the last item clicked? (e.g. button/node just clicked on) == IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered()
701  IMGUI_API bool IsItemVisible(); // is the last item visible? (items may be out of sight because of clipping/scrolling)
702  IMGUI_API bool IsItemEdited(); // did the last item modify its underlying value this frame? or was pressed? This is generally the same as the "bool" return value of many widgets.
703  IMGUI_API bool IsItemActivated(); // was the last item just made active (item was previously inactive).
704  IMGUI_API bool IsItemDeactivated(); // was the last item just made inactive (item was previously active). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that requires continuous editing.
705  IMGUI_API bool IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(); // was the last item just made inactive and made a value change when it was active? (e.g. Slider/Drag moved). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that requires continuous editing. Note that you may get false positives (some widgets such as Combo()/ListBox()/Selectable() will return true even when clicking an already selected item).
706  IMGUI_API bool IsItemToggledOpen(); // was the last item open state toggled? set by TreeNode().
707  IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemHovered(); // is any item hovered?
708  IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemActive(); // is any item active?
709  IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemFocused(); // is any item focused?
710  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectMin(); // get upper-left bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)
711  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectMax(); // get lower-right bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)
712  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectSize(); // get size of last item
713  IMGUI_API void SetItemAllowOverlap(); // allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. sometimes useful with invisible buttons, selectables, etc. to catch unused area.
714 
715  // Miscellaneous Utilities
716  IMGUI_API bool IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& size); // test if rectangle (of given size, starting from cursor position) is visible / not clipped.
717  IMGUI_API bool IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& rect_min, const ImVec2& rect_max); // test if rectangle (in screen space) is visible / not clipped. to perform coarse clipping on user's side.
718  IMGUI_API double GetTime(); // get global imgui time. incremented by io.DeltaTime every frame.
719  IMGUI_API int GetFrameCount(); // get global imgui frame count. incremented by 1 every frame.
720  IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetBackgroundDrawList(); // get background draw list for the viewport associated to the current window. this draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.
721  IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetForegroundDrawList(); // get foreground draw list for the viewport associated to the current window. this draw list will be the last rendered one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text over dear imgui contents.
722  IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetBackgroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport); // get background draw list for the given viewport. this draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.
723  IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetForegroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport); // get foreground draw list for the given viewport. this draw list will be the last rendered one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text over dear imgui contents.
724  IMGUI_API ImDrawListSharedData* GetDrawListSharedData(); // you may use this when creating your own ImDrawList instances.
725  IMGUI_API const char* GetStyleColorName(ImGuiCol idx); // get a string corresponding to the enum value (for display, saving, etc.).
726  IMGUI_API void SetStateStorage(ImGuiStorage* storage); // replace current window storage with our own (if you want to manipulate it yourself, typically clear subsection of it)
727  IMGUI_API ImGuiStorage* GetStateStorage();
728  IMGUI_API void CalcListClipping(int items_count, float items_height, int* out_items_display_start, int* out_items_display_end); // calculate coarse clipping for large list of evenly sized items. Prefer using the ImGuiListClipper higher-level helper if you can.
729  IMGUI_API bool BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame
730  IMGUI_API void EndChildFrame(); // always call EndChildFrame() regardless of BeginChildFrame() return values (which indicates a collapsed/clipped window)
731 
732  // Text Utilities
733  IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSize(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL, bool hide_text_after_double_hash = false, float wrap_width = -1.0f);
734 
735  // Color Utilities
736  IMGUI_API ImVec4 ColorConvertU32ToFloat4(ImU32 in);
737  IMGUI_API ImU32 ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(const ImVec4& in);
738  IMGUI_API void ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(float r, float g, float b, float& out_h, float& out_s, float& out_v);
739  IMGUI_API void ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(float h, float s, float v, float& out_r, float& out_g, float& out_b);
740 
741  // Inputs Utilities: Keyboard
742  // - For 'int user_key_index' you can use your own indices/enums according to how your back-end/engine stored them in io.KeysDown[].
743  // - We don't know the meaning of those value. You can use GetKeyIndex() to map a ImGuiKey_ value into the user index.
744  IMGUI_API int GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey imgui_key); // map ImGuiKey_* values into user's key index. == io.KeyMap[key]
745  IMGUI_API bool IsKeyDown(int user_key_index); // is key being held. == io.KeysDown[user_key_index].
746  IMGUI_API bool IsKeyPressed(int user_key_index, bool repeat = true); // was key pressed (went from !Down to Down)? if repeat=true, uses io.KeyRepeatDelay / KeyRepeatRate
747  IMGUI_API bool IsKeyReleased(int user_key_index); // was key released (went from Down to !Down)?
748  IMGUI_API int GetKeyPressedAmount(int key_index, float repeat_delay, float rate); // uses provided repeat rate/delay. return a count, most often 0 or 1 but might be >1 if RepeatRate is small enough that DeltaTime > RepeatRate
749  IMGUI_API void CaptureKeyboardFromApp(bool want_capture_keyboard_value = true); // attention: misleading name! manually override io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag next frame (said flag is entirely left for your application to handle). e.g. force capture keyboard when your widget is being hovered. This is equivalent to setting "io.WantCaptureKeyboard = want_capture_keyboard_value"; after the next NewFrame() call.
750 
751  // Inputs Utilities: Mouse
752  // - To refer to a mouse button, you may use named enums in your code e.g. ImGuiMouseButton_Left, ImGuiMouseButton_Right.
753  // - You can also use regular integer: it is forever guaranteed that 0=Left, 1=Right, 2=Middle.
754  // - Dragging operations are only reported after mouse has moved a certain distance away from the initial clicking position (see 'lock_threshold' and 'io.MouseDraggingThreshold')
755  IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button); // is mouse button held?
756  IMGUI_API bool IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, bool repeat = false); // did mouse button clicked? (went from !Down to Down)
757  IMGUI_API bool IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button); // did mouse button released? (went from Down to !Down)
758  IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button); // did mouse button double-clicked? a double-click returns false in IsMouseClicked(). uses io.MouseDoubleClickTime.
759  IMGUI_API bool IsMouseHoveringRect(const ImVec2& r_min, const ImVec2& r_max, bool clip = true);// is mouse hovering given bounding rect (in screen space). clipped by current clipping settings, but disregarding of other consideration of focus/window ordering/popup-block.
760  IMGUI_API bool IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2* mouse_pos = NULL); // by convention we use (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote that there is no mouse available
761  IMGUI_API bool IsAnyMouseDown(); // is any mouse button held?
762  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMousePos(); // shortcut to ImGui::GetIO().MousePos provided by user, to be consistent with other calls
763  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup(); // retrieve mouse position at the time of opening popup we have BeginPopup() into (helper to avoid user backing that value themselves)
764  IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold = -1.0f); // is mouse dragging? (if lock_threshold < -1.0f, uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold)
765  IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button = 0, float lock_threshold = -1.0f); // return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is pressed or was just released. This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once (if lock_threshold < -1.0f, uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold)
