766  IMGUI_API void ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button = 0); //
767  IMGUI_API ImGuiMouseCursor GetMouseCursor(); // get desired cursor type, reset in ImGui::NewFrame(), this is updated during the frame. valid before Render(). If you use software rendering by setting io.MouseDrawCursor ImGui will render those for you
768  IMGUI_API void SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type); // set desired cursor type
769  IMGUI_API void CaptureMouseFromApp(bool want_capture_mouse_value = true); // attention: misleading name! manually override io.WantCaptureMouse flag next frame (said flag is entirely left for your application to handle). This is equivalent to setting "io.WantCaptureMouse = want_capture_mouse_value;" after the next NewFrame() call.
770 
771  // Clipboard Utilities
772  // - Also see the LogToClipboard() function to capture GUI into clipboard, or easily output text data to the clipboard.
773  IMGUI_API const char* GetClipboardText();
774  IMGUI_API void SetClipboardText(const char* text);
775 
776  // Settings/.Ini Utilities
777  // - The disk functions are automatically called if io.IniFilename != NULL (default is "imgui.ini").
778  // - Set io.IniFilename to NULL to load/save manually. Read io.WantSaveIniSettings description about handling .ini saving manually.
779  IMGUI_API void LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char* ini_filename); // call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame(). NewFrame() automatically calls LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(io.IniFilename).
780  IMGUI_API void LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char* ini_data, size_t ini_size=0); // call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame() to provide .ini data from your own data source.
781  IMGUI_API void SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char* ini_filename); // this is automatically called (if io.IniFilename is not empty) a few seconds after any modification that should be reflected in the .ini file (and also by DestroyContext).
782  IMGUI_API const char* SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t* out_ini_size = NULL); // return a zero-terminated string with the .ini data which you can save by your own mean. call when io.WantSaveIniSettings is set, then save data by your own mean and clear io.WantSaveIniSettings.
783 
784  // Debug Utilities
785  IMGUI_API bool DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char* version_str, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2, size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_drawvert, size_t sz_drawidx); // This is called by IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() macro.
786 
787  // Memory Allocators
788  // - All those functions are not reliant on the current context.
789  // - If you reload the contents of imgui.cpp at runtime, you may need to call SetCurrentContext() + SetAllocatorFunctions() again because we use global storage for those.
790  IMGUI_API void SetAllocatorFunctions(void* (*alloc_func)(size_t sz, void* user_data), void (*free_func)(void* ptr, void* user_data), void* user_data = NULL);
791  IMGUI_API void* MemAlloc(size_t size);
792  IMGUI_API void MemFree(void* ptr);
793 
794  // (Optional) Platform/OS interface for multi-viewport support
795  // Read comments around the ImGuiPlatformIO structure for more details.
796  // Note: You may use GetWindowViewport() to get the current viewport of the current window.
797  IMGUI_API ImGuiPlatformIO& GetPlatformIO(); // platform/renderer functions, for back-end to setup + viewports list.
798  IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport* GetMainViewport(); // main viewport. same as GetPlatformIO().MainViewport == GetPlatformIO().Viewports[0].
799  IMGUI_API void UpdatePlatformWindows(); // call in main loop. will call CreateWindow/ResizeWindow/etc. platform functions for each secondary viewport, and DestroyWindow for each inactive viewport.
800  IMGUI_API void RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(void* platform_render_arg = NULL, void* renderer_render_arg = NULL); // call in main loop. will call RenderWindow/SwapBuffers platform functions for each secondary viewport which doesn't have the ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized flag set. May be reimplemented by user for custom rendering needs.
801  IMGUI_API void DestroyPlatformWindows(); // call DestroyWindow platform functions for all viewports. call from back-end Shutdown() if you need to close platform windows before imgui shutdown. otherwise will be called by DestroyContext().
802  IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport* FindViewportByID(ImGuiID id); // this is a helper for back-ends.
803  IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport* FindViewportByPlatformHandle(void* platform_handle); // this is a helper for back-ends. the type platform_handle is decided by the back-end (e.g. HWND, MyWindow*, GLFWwindow* etc.)
804 
805 } // namespace ImGui
806 
807 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
808 // Flags & Enumerations
809 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
810 
811 // Flags for ImGui::Begin()
812 enum ImGuiWindowFlags_
813 {
814  ImGuiWindowFlags_None = 0,
815  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar = 1 << 0, // Disable title-bar
816  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize = 1 << 1, // Disable user resizing with the lower-right grip
817  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove = 1 << 2, // Disable user moving the window
818  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar = 1 << 3, // Disable scrollbars (window can still scroll with mouse or programmatically)
819  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse = 1 << 4, // Disable user vertically scrolling with mouse wheel. On child window, mouse wheel will be forwarded to the parent unless NoScrollbar is also set.
820  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse = 1 << 5, // Disable user collapsing window by double-clicking on it. Also referred to as "window menu button" within a docking node.
821  ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize = 1 << 6, // Resize every window to its content every frame
822  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground = 1 << 7, // Disable drawing background color (WindowBg, etc.) and outside border. Similar as using SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f).
823  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings = 1 << 8, // Never load/save settings in .ini file
824  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs = 1 << 9, // Disable catching mouse, hovering test with pass through.
825  ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar = 1 << 10, // Has a menu-bar
826  ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar = 1 << 11, // Allow horizontal scrollbar to appear (off by default). You may use SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(width,0.0f)); prior to calling Begin() to specify width. Read code in imgui_demo in the "Horizontal Scrolling" section.
827  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1 << 12, // Disable taking focus when transitioning from hidden to visible state
828  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus = 1 << 13, // Disable bringing window to front when taking focus (e.g. clicking on it or programmatically giving it focus)
829  ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar= 1 << 14, // Always show vertical scrollbar (even if ContentSize.y < Size.y)
830  ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar=1<< 15, // Always show horizontal scrollbar (even if ContentSize.x < Size.x)
831  ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding = 1 << 16, // Ensure child windows without border uses style.WindowPadding (ignored by default for non-bordered child windows, because more convenient)
832  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs = 1 << 18, // No gamepad/keyboard navigation within the window
833  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus = 1 << 19, // No focusing toward this window with gamepad/keyboard navigation (e.g. skipped by CTRL+TAB)
834  ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument = 1 << 20, // Append '*' to title without affecting the ID, as a convenience to avoid using the ### operator. When used in a tab/docking context, tab is selected on closure and closure is deferred by one frame to allow code to cancel the closure (with a confirmation popup, etc.) without flicker.
835  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking = 1 << 21, // Disable docking of this window
836 
837  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus,
838  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse,
839  ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus,
840 
841  // [Internal]
842  ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened = 1 << 23, // [BETA] Allow gamepad/keyboard navigation to cross over parent border to this child (only use on child that have no scrolling!)
843  ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow = 1 << 24, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginChild()
844  ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip = 1 << 25, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginTooltip()
845  ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup = 1 << 26, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopup()
846  ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal = 1 << 27, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopupModal()
847  ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu = 1 << 28, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginMenu()
848  ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost = 1 << 29 // Don't use! For internal use by Begin()/NewFrame()
849 
850  // [Obsolete]
851  //ImGuiWindowFlags_ShowBorders = 1 << 7, // --> Set style.FrameBorderSize=1.0f or style.WindowBorderSize=1.0f to enable borders around items or windows.
852  //ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide = 1 << 17, // --> Set io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges=true and make sure mouse cursors are supported by back-end (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors)
853 };
854 
855 // Flags for ImGui::InputText()
856 enum ImGuiInputTextFlags_
857 {
858  ImGuiInputTextFlags_None = 0,
859  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal = 1 << 0, // Allow 0123456789.+-*/
860  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal = 1 << 1, // Allow 0123456789ABCDEFabcdef
861  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase = 1 << 2, // Turn a..z into A..Z
862  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank = 1 << 3, // Filter out spaces, tabs
863  ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll = 1 << 4, // Select entire text when first taking mouse focus
864  ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue = 1 << 5, // Return 'true' when Enter is pressed (as opposed to every time the value was modified). Consider looking at the IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() function.
865  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion = 1 << 6, // Callback on pressing TAB (for completion handling)
866  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory = 1 << 7, // Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows (for history handling)
867  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways = 1 << 8, // Callback on each iteration. User code may query cursor position, modify text buffer.
868  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter = 1 << 9, // Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.
869  ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput = 1 << 10, // Pressing TAB input a '\t' character into the text field
870  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine = 1 << 11, // In multi-line mode, unfocus with Enter, add new line with Ctrl+Enter (default is opposite: unfocus with Ctrl+Enter, add line with Enter).
871  ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll = 1 << 12, // Disable following the cursor horizontally
872  ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysInsertMode = 1 << 13, // Insert mode
873  ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly = 1 << 14, // Read-only mode
874  ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password = 1 << 15, // Password mode, display all characters as '*'
875  ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo = 1 << 16, // Disable undo/redo. Note that input text owns the text data while active, if you want to provide your own undo/redo stack you need e.g. to call ClearActiveID().
876  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific = 1 << 17, // Allow 0123456789.+-*/eE (Scientific notation input)
877  ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize = 1 << 18, // Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string to grow. Notify when the string wants to be resized (for string types which hold a cache of their Size). You will be provided a new BufSize in the callback and NEED to honor it. (see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example of using this)
878  // [Internal]
879  ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline = 1 << 20, // For internal use by InputTextMultiline()
880  ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited = 1 << 21 // For internal use by functions using InputText() before reformatting data
881 };
882 
883 // Flags for ImGui::TreeNodeEx(), ImGui::CollapsingHeader*()
884 enum ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_
885 {
886  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None = 0,
887  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected = 1 << 0, // Draw as selected
888  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed = 1 << 1, // Full colored frame (e.g. for CollapsingHeader)
889  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap = 1 << 2, // Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one
890  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen = 1 << 3, // Don't do a TreePush() when open (e.g. for CollapsingHeader) = no extra indent nor pushing on ID stack
891  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog = 1 << 4, // Don't automatically and temporarily open node when Logging is active (by default logging will automatically open tree nodes)
892  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen = 1 << 5, // Default node to be open
893  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick = 1 << 6, // Need double-click to open node
894  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow = 1 << 7, // Only open when clicking on the arrow part. If ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick is also set, single-click arrow or double-click all box to open.
895  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf = 1 << 8, // No collapsing, no arrow (use as a convenience for leaf nodes).
896  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet = 1 << 9, // Display a bullet instead of arrow
897  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_FramePadding = 1 << 10, // Use FramePadding (even for an unframed text node) to vertically align text baseline to regular widget height. Equivalent to calling AlignTextToFramePadding().
898  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth = 1 << 11, // Extend hit box to the right-most edge, even if not framed. This is not the default in order to allow adding other items on the same line. In the future we may refactor the hit system to be front-to-back, allowing natural overlaps and then this can become the default.
899  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth = 1 << 12, // Extend hit box to the left-most and right-most edges (bypass the indented area).
900  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere = 1 << 13, // (WIP) Nav: left direction may move to this TreeNode() from any of its child (items submitted between TreeNode and TreePop)
901  //ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoScrollOnOpen = 1 << 14, // FIXME: TODO: Disable automatic scroll on TreePop() if node got just open and contents is not visible
902  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog
903 };
904 
905 // Flags for ImGui::Selectable()
906 enum ImGuiSelectableFlags_
907 {
908  ImGuiSelectableFlags_None = 0,
909  ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups = 1 << 0, // Clicking this don't close parent popup window
910  ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns = 1 << 1, // Selectable frame can span all columns (text will still fit in current column)
911  ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick = 1 << 2, // Generate press events on double clicks too
912  ImGuiSelectableFlags_Disabled = 1 << 3, // Cannot be selected, display grayed out text
913  ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap = 1 << 4 // (WIP) Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one
914 };
915 
916 // Flags for ImGui::BeginCombo()
917 enum ImGuiComboFlags_
918 {
919  ImGuiComboFlags_None = 0,
920  ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft = 1 << 0, // Align the popup toward the left by default
921  ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall = 1 << 1, // Max ~4 items visible. Tip: If you want your combo popup to be a specific size you can use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() prior to calling BeginCombo()
922  ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular = 1 << 2, // Max ~8 items visible (default)
923  ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge = 1 << 3, // Max ~20 items visible
924  ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest = 1 << 4, // As many fitting items as possible
925  ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton = 1 << 5, // Display on the preview box without the square arrow button
926  ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview = 1 << 6, // Display only a square arrow button
927  ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_ = ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest
928 };
929 
930 // Flags for ImGui::BeginTabBar()
931 enum ImGuiTabBarFlags_
932 {
933  ImGuiTabBarFlags_None = 0,
934  ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable = 1 << 0, // Allow manually dragging tabs to re-order them + New tabs are appended at the end of list
935  ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs = 1 << 1, // Automatically select new tabs when they appear
936  ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton = 1 << 2, // Disable buttons to open the tab list popup
937  ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton = 1 << 3, // Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != NULL) with middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side with if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2)) *p_open = false.
938  ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButtons = 1 << 4, // Disable scrolling buttons (apply when fitting policy is ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll)
939  ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 5, // Disable tooltips when hovering a tab
940  ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown = 1 << 6, // Resize tabs when they don't fit
941  ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll = 1 << 7, // Add scroll buttons when tabs don't fit
942  ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown | ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll,
943  ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_ = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown
944 };
945 
946 // Flags for ImGui::BeginTabItem()
947 enum ImGuiTabItemFlags_
948 {
949  ImGuiTabItemFlags_None = 0,
950  ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument = 1 << 0, // Append '*' to title without affecting the ID, as a convenience to avoid using the ### operator. Also: tab is selected on closure and closure is deferred by one frame to allow code to undo it without flicker.
951  ImGuiTabItemFlags_SetSelected = 1 << 1, // Trigger flag to programmatically make the tab selected when calling BeginTabItem()
952  ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton = 1 << 2, // Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != NULL) with middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side with if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2)) *p_open = false.
953  ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId = 1 << 3 // Don't call PushID(tab->ID)/PopID() on BeginTabItem()/EndTabItem()
954 };
955 
956 // Flags for ImGui::IsWindowFocused()
957 enum ImGuiFocusedFlags_
958 {
959  ImGuiFocusedFlags_None = 0,
960  ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows = 1 << 0, // IsWindowFocused(): Return true if any children of the window is focused
961  ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow = 1 << 1, // IsWindowFocused(): Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
962  ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow = 1 << 2, // IsWindowFocused(): Return true if any window is focused. Important: If you are trying to tell how to dispatch your low-level inputs, do NOT use this. Use 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ!
963  ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootAndChildWindows = ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows
964 };
965 
966 // Flags for ImGui::IsItemHovered(), ImGui::IsWindowHovered()
967 // Note: if you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to Dear ImGui or to your app, you should use 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ!
968 // Note: windows with the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs flag are ignored by IsWindowHovered() calls.
969 enum ImGuiHoveredFlags_
970 {
971  ImGuiHoveredFlags_None = 0, // Return true if directly over the item/window, not obstructed by another window, not obstructed by an active popup or modal blocking inputs under them.
972  ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows = 1 << 0, // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any children of the window is hovered
973  ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow = 1 << 1, // IsWindowHovered() only: Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
974  ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow = 1 << 2, // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any window is hovered
975  ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup = 1 << 3, // Return true even if a popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window
976  //ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByModal = 1 << 4, // Return true even if a modal popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window. FIXME-TODO: Unavailable yet.
977  ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem = 1 << 5, // Return true even if an active item is blocking access to this item/window. Useful for Drag and Drop patterns.
978  ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped = 1 << 6, // Return true even if the position is obstructed or overlapped by another window
979  ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled = 1 << 7, // Return true even if the item is disabled
980  ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly = ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped,
981  ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootAndChildWindows = ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows
982 };
983 
984 // Flags for ImGui::DockSpace(), shared/inherited by child nodes.
985 // (Some flags can be applied to individual nodes directly)
986 // FIXME-DOCK: Also see ImGuiDockNodeFlagsPrivate_ which may involve using the WIP and internal DockBuilder api.
987 enum ImGuiDockNodeFlags_
988 {
989  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None = 0,
990  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly = 1 << 0, // Shared // Don't display the dockspace node but keep it alive. Windows docked into this dockspace node won't be undocked.
991  //ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCentralNode = 1 << 1, // Shared // Disable Central Node (the node which can stay empty)
992  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingInCentralNode = 1 << 2, // Shared // Disable docking inside the Central Node, which will be always kept empty.
993  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode = 1 << 3, // Shared // Enable passthru dockspace: 1) DockSpace() will render a ImGuiCol_WindowBg background covering everything excepted the Central Node when empty. Meaning the host window should probably use SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f) prior to Begin() when using this. 2) When Central Node is empty: let inputs pass-through + won't display a DockingEmptyBg background. See demo for details.
994  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoSplit = 1 << 4, // Shared/Local // Disable splitting the node into smaller nodes. Useful e.g. when embedding dockspaces into a main root one (the root one may have splitting disabled to reduce confusion). Note: when turned off, existing splits will be preserved.
995  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize = 1 << 5, // Shared/Local // Disable resizing node using the splitter/separators. Useful with programatically setup dockspaces.
996  ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar = 1 << 6 // Shared/Local // Tab bar will automatically hide when there is a single window in the dock node.
997 };
998 
999 // Flags for ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(), ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload()
1000 enum ImGuiDragDropFlags_
1001 {
1002  ImGuiDragDropFlags_None = 0,
1003  // BeginDragDropSource() flags
1004  ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip = 1 << 0, // By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you can display a preview or description of the source contents. This flag disable this behavior.
1005  ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover = 1 << 1, // By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered() will return false, to avoid subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disable this behavior so you can still call IsItemHovered() on the source item.
1006  ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers = 1 << 2, // Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by holding over them while dragging a source item.
1007  ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID = 1 << 3, // Allow items such as Text(), Image() that have no unique identifier to be used as drag source, by manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their window-relative position. This is extremely unusual within the dear imgui ecosystem and so we made it explicit.
1008  ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern = 1 << 4, // External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current item/window info. Will always return true. Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.
1009  ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload = 1 << 5, // Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be submitted (otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged)
1010  // AcceptDragDropPayload() flags
1011  ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery = 1 << 10, // AcceptDragDropPayload() will returns true even before the mouse button is released. You can then call IsDelivery() to test if the payload needs to be delivered.
1012  ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect = 1 << 11, // Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.
1013  ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip = 1 << 12, // Request hiding the BeginDragDropSource tooltip from the BeginDragDropTarget site.
1014  ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly = ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery | ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect // For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.
1015 };
1016 
1017 // Standard Drag and Drop payload types. You can define you own payload types using short strings. Types starting with '_' are defined by Dear ImGui.
1018 #define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F "_COL3F" // float[3]: Standard type for colors, without alpha. User code may use this type.
1019 #define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F "_COL4F" // float[4]: Standard type for colors. User code may use this type.
1020 
1021 // A primary data type
1022 enum ImGuiDataType_
1023 {
1024  ImGuiDataType_S8, // signed char / char (with sensible compilers)
1025  ImGuiDataType_U8, // unsigned char
1026  ImGuiDataType_S16, // short
1027  ImGuiDataType_U16, // unsigned short
1028  ImGuiDataType_S32, // int
1029  ImGuiDataType_U32, // unsigned int
1030  ImGuiDataType_S64, // long long / __int64
1031  ImGuiDataType_U64, // unsigned long long / unsigned __int64
1032  ImGuiDataType_Float, // float
1033  ImGuiDataType_Double, // double
1034  ImGuiDataType_COUNT
1035 };
1036 
1037 // A cardinal direction
1038 enum ImGuiDir_
1039 {
1040  ImGuiDir_None = -1,
1041  ImGuiDir_Left = 0,
1042  ImGuiDir_Right = 1,
1043  ImGuiDir_Up = 2,
1044  ImGuiDir_Down = 3,
1045  ImGuiDir_COUNT
1046 };
1047 
1048 // User fill ImGuiIO.KeyMap[] array with indices into the ImGuiIO.KeysDown[512] array
1049 enum ImGuiKey_
1050 {
1051  ImGuiKey_Tab,
1052  ImGuiKey_LeftArrow,
1053  ImGuiKey_RightArrow,
1054  ImGuiKey_UpArrow,
1055  ImGuiKey_DownArrow,
1056  ImGuiKey_PageUp,
1057  ImGuiKey_PageDown,
1058  ImGuiKey_Home,
1059  ImGuiKey_End,
1060  ImGuiKey_Insert,
1061  ImGuiKey_Delete,
1062  ImGuiKey_Backspace,
1063  ImGuiKey_Space,
1064  ImGuiKey_Enter,
1065  ImGuiKey_Escape,
1066  ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter,
1067  ImGuiKey_A, // for text edit CTRL+A: select all
1068  ImGuiKey_C, // for text edit CTRL+C: copy
1069  ImGuiKey_V, // for text edit CTRL+V: paste
1070  ImGuiKey_X, // for text edit CTRL+X: cut
1071  ImGuiKey_Y, // for text edit CTRL+Y: redo
1072  ImGuiKey_Z, // for text edit CTRL+Z: undo
1073  ImGuiKey_COUNT
1074 };
1075 
1076 // To test io.KeyMods (which is a combination of individual fields io.KeyCtrl, io.KeyShift, io.KeyAlt set by user/back-end)
1077 enum ImGuiKeyModFlags_
1078 {
1079  ImGuiKeyModFlags_None = 0,
1080  ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl = 1 << 0,
1081  ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift = 1 << 1,
1082  ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt = 1 << 2,
1083  ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super = 1 << 3
1084 };
1085 
1086 // Gamepad/Keyboard navigation
1087 // Keyboard: Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard to enable. NewFrame() will automatically fill io.NavInputs[] based on your io.KeysDown[] + io.KeyMap[] arrays.
1088 // Gamepad: Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad to enable. Back-end: set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad and fill the io.NavInputs[] fields before calling NewFrame(). Note that io.NavInputs[] is cleared by EndFrame().
1089 // Read instructions in imgui.cpp for more details. Download PNG/PSD at http://goo.gl/9LgVZW.
1090 enum ImGuiNavInput_
1091 {
1092  // Gamepad Mapping
1093  ImGuiNavInput_Activate, // activate / open / toggle / tweak value // e.g. Cross (PS4), A (Xbox), A (Switch), Space (Keyboard)
1094  ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, // cancel / close / exit // e.g. Circle (PS4), B (Xbox), B (Switch), Escape (Keyboard)
1095  ImGuiNavInput_Input, // text input / on-screen keyboard // e.g. Triang.(PS4), Y (Xbox), X (Switch), Return (Keyboard)
1096  ImGuiNavInput_Menu, // tap: toggle menu / hold: focus, move, resize // e.g. Square (PS4), X (Xbox), Y (Switch), Alt (Keyboard)
1097  ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, // move / tweak / resize window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. D-pad Left/Right/Up/Down (Gamepads), Arrow keys (Keyboard)
1098  ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, //
1099  ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, //
1100  ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, //
1101  ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, // scroll / move window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. Left Analog Stick Left/Right/Up/Down
1102  ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, //
1103  ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, //
1104  ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, //
1105  ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, // next window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. L1 or L2 (PS4), LB or LT (Xbox), L or ZL (Switch)
1106  ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, // prev window (w/ PadMenu) // e.g. R1 or R2 (PS4), RB or RT (Xbox), R or ZL (Switch)
1107  ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow, // slower tweaks // e.g. L1 or L2 (PS4), LB or LT (Xbox), L or ZL (Switch)
1108  ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast, // faster tweaks // e.g. R1 or R2 (PS4), RB or RT (Xbox), R or ZL (Switch)
1109 
1110  // [Internal] Don't use directly! This is used internally to differentiate keyboard from gamepad inputs for behaviors that require to differentiate them.
1111  // Keyboard behavior that have no corresponding gamepad mapping (e.g. CTRL+TAB) will be directly reading from io.KeysDown[] instead of io.NavInputs[].
1112  ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_, // toggle menu // = io.KeyAlt
1113  ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, // move left // = Arrow keys
1114  ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, // move right
1115  ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, // move up
1116  ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, // move down
1117  ImGuiNavInput_COUNT,
1118  ImGuiNavInput_InternalStart_ = ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_
1119 };
1120 
1121 // Configuration flags stored in io.ConfigFlags. Set by user/application.
1122 enum ImGuiConfigFlags_
1123 {
1124  ImGuiConfigFlags_None = 0,
1125  ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard = 1 << 0, // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. NewFrame() will automatically fill io.NavInputs[] based on io.KeysDown[].
1126  ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad = 1 << 1, // Master gamepad navigation enable flag. This is mostly to instruct your imgui back-end to fill io.NavInputs[]. Back-end also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.
1127  ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is awkward. Will update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true. If enabled you MUST honor io.WantSetMousePos requests in your binding, otherwise ImGui will react as if the mouse is jumping around back and forth.
1128  ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard = 1 << 3, // Instruct navigation to not set the io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag when io.NavActive is set.
1129  ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse = 1 << 4, // Instruct imgui to clear mouse position/buttons in NewFrame(). This allows ignoring the mouse information set by the back-end.
1130  ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange = 1 << 5, // Instruct back-end to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the back-end cursor changes are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead.
1131 
1132  // [BETA] Docking
1133  ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable = 1 << 6, // Docking enable flags.
1134 
1135  // [BETA] Viewports
1136  // When using viewports it is recommended that your default value for ImGuiCol_WindowBg is opaque (Alpha=1.0) so transition to a viewport won't be noticeable.
1137  ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable = 1 << 10, // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiConfigFlags_PlatformHasViewports + ImGuiConfigFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective back-ends)
1138  ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports= 1 << 14, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main window itself is up to your application.
1139  ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts = 1 << 15, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress.
1140 
1141  // User storage (to allow your back-end/engine to communicate to code that may be shared between multiple projects. Those flags are not used by core Dear ImGui)
1142  ImGuiConfigFlags_IsSRGB = 1 << 20, // Application is SRGB-aware.
1143  ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen = 1 << 21 // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse.
1144 };
1145 
1146 // Back-end capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. Set by imgui_impl_xxx or custom back-end.
1147 enum ImGuiBackendFlags_
1148 {
1149  ImGuiBackendFlags_None = 0,
1150  ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad = 1 << 0, // Back-end Platform supports gamepad and currently has one connected.
1151  ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors = 1 << 1, // Back-end Platform supports honoring GetMouseCursor() value to change the OS cursor shape.
1152  ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // Back-end Platform supports io.WantSetMousePos requests to reposition the OS mouse position (only used if ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos is set).
1153  ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset = 1 << 3, // Back-end Renderer supports ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices) while still using 16-bit indices.
1154 
1155  // [BETA] Viewports
1156  ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports = 1 << 10, // Back-end Platform supports multiple viewports.
1157  ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport=1 << 11, // Back-end Platform supports setting io.MouseHoveredViewport to the viewport directly under the mouse _IGNORING_ viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag and _REGARDLESS_ of whether another viewport is focused and may be capturing the mouse. This information is _NOT EASY_ to provide correctly with most high-level engines! Don't set this without studying how the examples/ back-end handle it!
1158  ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports = 1 << 12 // Back-end Renderer supports multiple viewports.
1159 };
1160

1171  ImGuiCol_FrameBg, // Background of checkbox, radio button, plot, slider, text input

1189  ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered,
1190  ImGuiCol_HeaderActive,

1198  ImGuiCol_TabHovered,
1199  ImGuiCol_TabActive,
1200  ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused,
1201  ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive,
1202  ImGuiCol_DockingPreview, // Preview overlay color when about to docking something
1203  ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg, // Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it)
1204  ImGuiCol_PlotLines,

1207  ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered,
1208  ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg,
