1211  ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, // Highlight window when using CTRL+TAB
1212  ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active
1213  ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active
1214  ImGuiCol_COUNT
1215 
1216  // Obsolete names (will be removed)
1217 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1218  , ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDarkening = ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg // [renamed in 1.63]
1219  //, ImGuiCol_CloseButton, ImGuiCol_CloseButtonActive, ImGuiCol_CloseButtonHovered// [unused since 1.60+] the close button now uses regular button colors.
1220 #endif
1221 };
1222 
1223 // Enumeration for PushStyleVar() / PopStyleVar() to temporarily modify the ImGuiStyle structure.
1224 // - The enum only refers to fields of ImGuiStyle which makes sense to be pushed/popped inside UI code.
1225 // During initialization or between frames, feel free to just poke into ImGuiStyle directly.
1226 // - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _second column_ below to find the actual members and their description.
1227 // In Visual Studio IDE: CTRL+comma ("Edit.NavigateTo") can follow symbols in comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
1228 // With Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols in comments.
1229 // - When changing this enum, you need to update the associated internal table GStyleVarInfo[] accordingly. This is where we link enum values to members offset/type.
1230 enum ImGuiStyleVar_
1231 {
1232  // Enum name --------------------- // Member in ImGuiStyle structure (see ImGuiStyle for descriptions)
1233  ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, // float Alpha
1234  ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, // ImVec2 WindowPadding
1235  ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, // float WindowRounding
1236  ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize, // float WindowBorderSize
1237  ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, // ImVec2 WindowMinSize
1238  ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign, // ImVec2 WindowTitleAlign
1239  ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, // float ChildRounding
1240  ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, // float ChildBorderSize
1241  ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding, // float PopupRounding
1242  ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize, // float PopupBorderSize
1243  ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, // ImVec2 FramePadding
1244  ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, // float FrameRounding
1245  ImGuiStyleVar_FrameBorderSize, // float FrameBorderSize
1246  ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, // ImVec2 ItemSpacing
1247  ImGuiStyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing, // ImVec2 ItemInnerSpacing
1248  ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, // float IndentSpacing
1249  ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarSize, // float ScrollbarSize
1250  ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarRounding, // float ScrollbarRounding
1251  ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize, // float GrabMinSize
1252  ImGuiStyleVar_GrabRounding, // float GrabRounding
1253  ImGuiStyleVar_TabRounding, // float TabRounding
1254  ImGuiStyleVar_ButtonTextAlign, // ImVec2 ButtonTextAlign
1255  ImGuiStyleVar_SelectableTextAlign, // ImVec2 SelectableTextAlign
1256  ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT
1257 
1258  // Obsolete names (will be removed)
1259 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1260  , ImGuiStyleVar_Count_ = ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT // [renamed in 1.60]
1261 #endif
1262 };
1263 
1264 // Flags for ColorEdit3() / ColorEdit4() / ColorPicker3() / ColorPicker4() / ColorButton()
1265 enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_
1266 {
1267  ImGuiColorEditFlags_None = 0,
1268  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha = 1 << 1, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component (will only read 3 components from the input pointer).
1269  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker = 1 << 2, // // ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on colored square.
1270  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions = 1 << 3, // // ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.
1271  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview = 1 << 4, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable colored square preview next to the inputs. (e.g. to show only the inputs)
1272  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs = 1 << 5, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text widgets (e.g. to show only the small preview colored square).
1273  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 6, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.
1274  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel = 1 << 7, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).
1275  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview = 1 << 8, // // ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker, use small colored square preview instead.
1276  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop = 1 << 9, // // ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.
1277  ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder = 1 << 10, // // ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)
1278 
1279  // User Options (right-click on widget to change some of them).
1280  ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar = 1 << 16, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.
1281  ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview = 1 << 17, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display preview as a transparent color over a checkerboard, instead of opaque.
1282  ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf= 1 << 18, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half checkerboard, instead of opaque.
1283  ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR = 1 << 19, // // (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).
1284  ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB = 1 << 20, // [Display] // ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex. ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.
1285  ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV = 1 << 21, // [Display] // "
1286  ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex = 1 << 22, // [Display] // "
1287  ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 = 1 << 23, // [DataType] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.
1288  ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float = 1 << 24, // [DataType] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.
1289  ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar = 1 << 25, // [Picker] // ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.
1290  ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel = 1 << 26, // [Picker] // ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.
1291  ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB = 1 << 27, // [Input] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.
1292  ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV = 1 << 28, // [Input] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.
1293 
1294  // Defaults Options. You can set application defaults using SetColorEditOptions(). The intent is that you probably don't want to
1295  // override them in most of your calls. Let the user choose via the option menu and/or call SetColorEditOptions() once during startup.
1296  ImGuiColorEditFlags__OptionsDefault = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8|ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB|ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB|ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
1297 
1298  // [Internal] Masks
1299  ImGuiColorEditFlags__DisplayMask = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB|ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV|ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex,
1300  ImGuiColorEditFlags__DataTypeMask = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8|ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float,
1301  ImGuiColorEditFlags__PickerMask = ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel|ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
1302  ImGuiColorEditFlags__InputMask = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB|ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV
1303 
1304  // Obsolete names (will be removed)
1305 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1306  , ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HSV = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HEX = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex // [renamed in 1.69]
1307 #endif
1308 };
1309 
1310 // Identify a mouse button.
1311 // Those values are guaranteed to be stable and we frequently use 0/1 directly. Named enums provided for convenience.
1312 enum ImGuiMouseButton_
1313 {
1314  ImGuiMouseButton_Left = 0,
1315  ImGuiMouseButton_Right = 1,
1316  ImGuiMouseButton_Middle = 2,
1317  ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT = 5
1318 };
1319 
1320 // Enumeration for GetMouseCursor()
1321 // User code may request binding to display given cursor by calling SetMouseCursor(), which is why we have some cursors that are marked unused here
1322 enum ImGuiMouseCursor_
1323 {
1324  ImGuiMouseCursor_None = -1,
1325  ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow = 0,
1326  ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput, // When hovering over InputText, etc.
1327  ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeAll, // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions)
1328  ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS, // When hovering over an horizontal border
1329  ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW, // When hovering over a vertical border or a column
1330  ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW, // When hovering over the bottom-left corner of a window
1331  ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE, // When hovering over the bottom-right corner of a window
1332  ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand, // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions. Use for e.g. hyperlinks)
1333  ImGuiMouseCursor_NotAllowed, // When hovering something with disallowed interaction. Usually a crossed circle.
1334  ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT
1335 
1336  // Obsolete names (will be removed)
1337 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1338  , ImGuiMouseCursor_Count_ = ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT // [renamed in 1.60]
1339 #endif
1340 };
1341 
1342 // Enumeration for ImGui::SetWindow***(), SetNextWindow***(), SetNextItem***() functions
1343 // Represent a condition.
1344 // Important: Treat as a regular enum! Do NOT combine multiple values using binary operators! All the functions above treat 0 as a shortcut to ImGuiCond_Always.
1345 enum ImGuiCond_
1346 {
1347  ImGuiCond_Always = 1 << 0, // Set the variable
1348  ImGuiCond_Once = 1 << 1, // Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)
1349  ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver = 1 << 2, // Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data (no entry in .ini file)
1350  ImGuiCond_Appearing = 1 << 3 // Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being hidden/inactive (or the first time)
1351 };
1352 
1353 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1354 // Helpers: Memory allocations macros
1355 // IM_MALLOC(), IM_FREE(), IM_NEW(), IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(), IM_DELETE()
1356 // We call C++ constructor on own allocated memory via the placement "new(ptr) Type()" syntax.
1357 // Defining a custom placement new() with a dummy parameter allows us to bypass including <new> which on some platforms complains when user has disabled exceptions.
1358 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1359 
1360 struct ImNewDummy {};
1361 inline void* operator new(size_t, ImNewDummy, void* ptr) { return ptr; }
1362 inline void operator delete(void*, ImNewDummy, void*) {} // This is only required so we can use the symmetrical new()
1363 #define IM_ALLOC(_SIZE) ImGui::MemAlloc(_SIZE)
1364 #define IM_FREE(_PTR) ImGui::MemFree(_PTR)
1365 #define IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(_PTR) new(ImNewDummy(), _PTR)
1366 #define IM_NEW(_TYPE) new(ImNewDummy(), ImGui::MemAlloc(sizeof(_TYPE))) _TYPE
1367 template<typename T> void IM_DELETE(T* p) { if (p) { p->~T(); ImGui::MemFree(p); } }
1368 
1369 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1370 // Helper: ImVector<>
1371 // Lightweight std::vector<>-like class to avoid dragging dependencies (also, some implementations of STL with debug enabled are absurdly slow, we bypass it so our code runs fast in debug).
1372 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1373 // - You generally do NOT need to care or use this ever. But we need to make it available in imgui.h because some of our public structures are relying on it.
1374 // - We use std-like naming convention here, which is a little unusual for this codebase.
1375 // - Important: clear() frees memory, resize(0) keep the allocated buffer. We use resize(0) a lot to intentionally recycle allocated buffers across frames and amortize our costs.
1376 // - Important: our implementation does NOT call C++ constructors/destructors, we treat everything as raw data! This is intentional but be extra mindful of that,
1377 // Do NOT use this class as a std::vector replacement in your own code! Many of the structures used by dear imgui can be safely initialized by a zero-memset.
1378 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1379 
1380 template<typename T>
1381 struct ImVector
1382 {
1383  int Size;
1384  int Capacity;
1385  T* Data;
1386 
1387  // Provide standard typedefs but we don't use them ourselves.
1388  typedef T value_type;
1389  typedef value_type* iterator;
1390  typedef const value_type* const_iterator;
1391 
1392  // Constructors, destructor
1393  inline ImVector() { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; }
1394  inline ImVector(const ImVector<T>& src) { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; operator=(src); }
1395  inline ImVector<T>& operator=(const ImVector<T>& src) { clear(); resize(src.Size); memcpy(Data, src.Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); return *this; }
1396  inline ~ImVector() { if (Data) IM_FREE(Data); }
1397 
1398  inline bool empty() const { return Size == 0; }
1399  inline int size() const { return Size; }
1400  inline int size_in_bytes() const { return Size * (int)sizeof(T); }
1401  inline int capacity() const { return Capacity; }
1402  inline T& operator[](int i) { IM_ASSERT(i < Size); return Data[i]; }
1403  inline const T& operator[](int i) const { IM_ASSERT(i < Size); return Data[i]; }
1404 
1405  inline void clear() { if (Data) { Size = Capacity = 0; IM_FREE(Data); Data = NULL; } }
1406  inline T* begin() { return Data; }
1407  inline const T* begin() const { return Data; }
1408  inline T* end() { return Data + Size; }
1409  inline const T* end() const { return Data + Size; }
1410  inline T& front() { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[0]; }
1411  inline const T& front() const { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[0]; }
1412  inline T& back() { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[Size - 1]; }
1413  inline const T& back() const { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[Size - 1]; }
1414  inline void swap(ImVector<T>& rhs) { int rhs_size = rhs.Size; rhs.Size = Size; Size = rhs_size; int rhs_cap = rhs.Capacity; rhs.Capacity = Capacity; Capacity = rhs_cap; T* rhs_data = rhs.Data; rhs.Data = Data; Data = rhs_data; }
1415 
1416  inline int _grow_capacity(int sz) const { int new_capacity = Capacity ? (Capacity + Capacity/2) : 8; return new_capacity > sz ? new_capacity : sz; }
1417  inline void resize(int new_size) { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); Size = new_size; }
1418  inline void resize(int new_size, const T& v) { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); if (new_size > Size) for (int n = Size; n < new_size; n++) memcpy(&Data[n], &v, sizeof(v)); Size = new_size; }
1419  inline void shrink(int new_size) { IM_ASSERT(new_size <= Size); Size = new_size; } // Resize a vector to a smaller size, guaranteed not to cause a reallocation
1420  inline void reserve(int new_capacity) { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; T* new_data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); if (Data) { memcpy(new_data, Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); IM_FREE(Data); } Data = new_data; Capacity = new_capacity; }
1421 
1422  // NB: It is illegal to call push_back/push_front/insert with a reference pointing inside the ImVector data itself! e.g. v.push_back(v[10]) is forbidden.
1423  inline void push_back(const T& v) { if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); memcpy(&Data[Size], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; }
1424  inline void pop_back() { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); Size--; }
1425  inline void push_front(const T& v) { if (Size == 0) push_back(v); else insert(Data, v); }
1426  inline T* erase(const T* it) { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data+Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + 1, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - 1) * sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }
1427  inline T* erase(const T* it, const T* it_last){ IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data+Size && it_last > it && it_last <= Data+Size); const ptrdiff_t count = it_last - it; const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + count, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - count) * sizeof(T)); Size -= (int)count; return Data + off; }
1428  inline T* erase_unsorted(const T* it) { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data+Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (it < Data+Size-1) memcpy(Data + off, Data + Size - 1, sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }
1429  inline T* insert(const T* it, const T& v) { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it <= Data+Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); if (off < (int)Size) memmove(Data + off + 1, Data + off, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off) * sizeof(T)); memcpy(&Data[off], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; return Data + off; }
1430  inline bool contains(const T& v) const { const T* data = Data; const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data++ == v) return true; return false; }
1431  inline T* find(const T& v) { T* data = Data; const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }
1432  inline const T* find(const T& v) const { const T* data = Data; const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }
1433  inline bool find_erase(const T& v) { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase(it); return true; } return false; }
1434  inline bool find_erase_unsorted(const T& v) { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase_unsorted(it); return true; } return false; }
1435  inline int index_from_ptr(const T* it) const { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; return (int)off; }
1436 };
1437 
1438 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1439 // ImGuiStyle
1440 // You may modify the ImGui::GetStyle() main instance during initialization and before NewFrame().
1441 // During the frame, use ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_XXXX)/PopStyleVar() to alter the main style values,
1442 // and ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_XXX)/PopStyleColor() for colors.
1443 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1444 
1445 struct ImGuiStyle
1446 {
1447  float Alpha; // Global alpha applies to everything in Dear ImGui.
1448  ImVec2 WindowPadding; // Padding within a window.
1449  float WindowRounding; // Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows.
1450  float WindowBorderSize; // Thickness of border around windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
1451  ImVec2 WindowMinSize; // Minimum window size. This is a global setting. If you want to constraint individual windows, use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints().
1452  ImVec2 WindowTitleAlign; // Alignment for title bar text. Defaults to (0.0f,0.5f) for left-aligned,vertically centered.
1453  ImGuiDir WindowMenuButtonPosition; // Side of the collapsing/docking button in the title bar (None/Left/Right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Left.
1454  float ChildRounding; // Radius of child window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows.
1455  float ChildBorderSize; // Thickness of border around child windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
1456  float PopupRounding; // Radius of popup window corners rounding. (Note that tooltip windows use WindowRounding)
1457  float PopupBorderSize; // Thickness of border around popup/tooltip windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
1458  ImVec2 FramePadding; // Padding within a framed rectangle (used by most widgets).
1459  float FrameRounding; // Radius of frame corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular frame (used by most widgets).
1460  float FrameBorderSize; // Thickness of border around frames. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
1461  ImVec2 ItemSpacing; // Horizontal and vertical spacing between widgets/lines.
1462  ImVec2 ItemInnerSpacing; // Horizontal and vertical spacing between within elements of a composed widget (e.g. a slider and its label).
1463  ImVec2 TouchExtraPadding; // Expand reactive bounding box for touch-based system where touch position is not accurate enough. Unfortunately we don't sort widgets so priority on overlap will always be given to the first widget. So don't grow this too much!
1464  float IndentSpacing; // Horizontal indentation when e.g. entering a tree node. Generally == (FontSize + FramePadding.x*2).
1465  float ColumnsMinSpacing; // Minimum horizontal spacing between two columns. Preferably > (FramePadding.x + 1).
1466  float ScrollbarSize; // Width of the vertical scrollbar, Height of the horizontal scrollbar.
1467  float ScrollbarRounding; // Radius of grab corners for scrollbar.
1468  float GrabMinSize; // Minimum width/height of a grab box for slider/scrollbar.
1469  float GrabRounding; // Radius of grabs corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular slider grabs.
1470  float TabRounding; // Radius of upper corners of a tab. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular tabs.
1471  float TabBorderSize; // Thickness of border around tabs.
1472  float TabMinWidthForUnselectedCloseButton; // Minimum width for close button to appears on an unselected tab when hovered. Set to 0.0f to always show when hovering, set to FLT_MAX to never show close button unless selected.
1473  ImGuiDir ColorButtonPosition; // Side of the color button in the ColorEdit4 widget (left/right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Right.
1474  ImVec2 ButtonTextAlign; // Alignment of button text when button is larger than text. Defaults to (0.5f, 0.5f) (centered).
1475  ImVec2 SelectableTextAlign; // Alignment of selectable text. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.0f) (top-left aligned). It's generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay multiple items on a same line.
1476  ImVec2 DisplayWindowPadding; // Window position are clamped to be visible within the display area or monitors by at least this amount. Only applies to regular windows.
1477  ImVec2 DisplaySafeAreaPadding; // If you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV) increase the safe area padding. Apply to popups/tooltips as well regular windows. NB: Prefer configuring your TV sets correctly!
1478  float MouseCursorScale; // Scale software rendered mouse cursor (when io.MouseDrawCursor is enabled). We apply per-monitor DPI scaling over this scale. May be removed later.
1479  bool AntiAliasedLines; // Enable anti-aliasing on lines/borders. Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU.
1480  bool AntiAliasedFill; // Enable anti-aliasing on filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles, etc.)
1481  float CurveTessellationTol; // Tessellation tolerance when using PathBezierCurveTo() without a specific number of segments. Decrease for highly tessellated curves (higher quality, more polygons), increase to reduce quality.
1482  float CircleSegmentMaxError; // Maximum error (in pixels) allowed when using AddCircle()/AddCircleFilled() or drawing rounded corner rectangles with no explicit segment count specified. Decrease for higher quality but more geometry.
1483  ImVec4 Colors[ImGuiCol_COUNT];
1484 
1485  IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle();
1486  IMGUI_API void ScaleAllSizes(float scale_factor);
1487 };
1488 
1489 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1490 // ImGuiIO
1491 // Communicate most settings and inputs/outputs to Dear ImGui using this structure.
1492 // Access via ImGui::GetIO(). Read 'Programmer guide' section in .cpp file for general usage.
1493 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1494 
1495 struct ImGuiIO
1496 {
1497  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1498  // Configuration (fill once) // Default value
1499  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1500 
1501  ImGuiConfigFlags ConfigFlags; // = 0 // See ImGuiConfigFlags_ enum. Set by user/application. Gamepad/keyboard navigation options, etc.
1502  ImGuiBackendFlags BackendFlags; // = 0 // See ImGuiBackendFlags_ enum. Set by back-end (imgui_impl_xxx files or custom back-end) to communicate features supported by the back-end.
1503  ImVec2 DisplaySize; // <unset> // Main display size, in pixels. This is for the default viewport.
1504  float DeltaTime; // = 1.0f/60.0f // Time elapsed since last frame, in seconds.
1505  float IniSavingRate; // = 5.0f // Minimum time between saving positions/sizes to .ini file, in seconds.
1506  const char* IniFilename; // = "imgui.ini" // Path to .ini file. Set NULL to disable automatic .ini loading/saving, if e.g. you want to manually load/save from memory.
1507  const char* LogFilename; // = "imgui_log.txt"// Path to .log file (default parameter to ImGui::LogToFile when no file is specified).
1508  float MouseDoubleClickTime; // = 0.30f // Time for a double-click, in seconds.
1509  float MouseDoubleClickMaxDist; // = 6.0f // Distance threshold to stay in to validate a double-click, in pixels.
1510  float MouseDragThreshold; // = 6.0f // Distance threshold before considering we are dragging.
1511  int KeyMap[ImGuiKey_COUNT]; // <unset> // Map of indices into the KeysDown[512] entries array which represent your "native" keyboard state.
1512  float KeyRepeatDelay; // = 0.250f // When holding a key/button, time before it starts repeating, in seconds (for buttons in Repeat mode, etc.).
1513  float KeyRepeatRate; // = 0.050f // When holding a key/button, rate at which it repeats, in seconds.
1514  void* UserData; // = NULL // Store your own data for retrieval by callbacks.
1515 
1516  ImFontAtlas*Fonts; // <auto> // Font atlas: load, rasterize and pack one or more fonts into a single texture.
1517  float FontGlobalScale; // = 1.0f // Global scale all fonts
1518  bool FontAllowUserScaling; // = false // Allow user scaling text of individual window with CTRL+Wheel.
1519  ImFont* FontDefault; // = NULL // Font to use on NewFrame(). Use NULL to uses Fonts->Fonts[0].
1520  ImVec2 DisplayFramebufferScale; // = (1, 1) // For retina display or other situations where window coordinates are different from framebuffer coordinates. This generally ends up in ImDrawData::FramebufferScale.
1521 
1522  // Docking options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable is set)
1523  bool ConfigDockingNoSplit; // = false // Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.
1524  bool ConfigDockingWithShift; // = false // Enable docking with holding Shift key (reduce visual noise, allows dropping in wider space)
1525  bool ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar; // = false // [BETA] [FIXME: This currently creates regression with auto-sizing and general overhead] Make every single floating window display within a docking node.
1526  bool ConfigDockingTransparentPayload;// = false // [BETA] Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.
1527 
1528  // Viewport options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is set)
1529  bool ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge; // = false; // Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when overlapping it. May also set ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge on individual viewport.
1530  bool ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon; // = false // Disable default OS task bar icon flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want a task bar icon, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon will be set on it.
1531  bool ConfigViewportsNoDecoration; // = true // [BETA] Disable default OS window decoration flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want window decorations, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration will be set on it. Enabling decoration can create subsequent issues at OS levels (e.g. minimum window size).
1532  bool ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent; // = false // Disable default OS parenting to main viewport for secondary viewports. By default, viewports are marked with ParentViewportId = <main_viewport>, expecting the platform back-end to setup a parent/child relationship between the OS windows (some back-end may ignore this). Set to true if you want the default to be 0, then all viewports will be top-level OS windows.
1533 
1534  // Miscellaneous options
1535  bool MouseDrawCursor; // = false // Request ImGui to draw a mouse cursor for you (if you are on a platform without a mouse cursor). Cannot be easily renamed to 'io.ConfigXXX' because this is frequently used by back-end implementations.
1536  bool ConfigMacOSXBehaviors; // = defined(__APPLE__) // OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of selecting whole text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl (was called io.OptMacOSXBehaviors prior to 1.63)
1537  bool ConfigInputTextCursorBlink; // = true // Set to false to disable blinking cursor, for users who consider it distracting. (was called: io.OptCursorBlink prior to 1.63)
1538  bool ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges; // = true // Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner. This requires (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors) because it needs mouse cursor feedback. (This used to be a per-window ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide flag)
1539  bool ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly; // = false // [BETA] Set to true to only allow moving windows when clicked+dragged from the title bar. Windows without a title bar are not affected.
1540  float ConfigWindowsMemoryCompactTimer;// = 60.0f // [BETA] Compact window memory usage when unused. Set to -1.0f to disable.
1541 
1542  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1543  // Platform Functions
1544  // (the imgui_impl_xxxx back-end files are setting those up for you)
1545  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1546 
1547  // Optional: Platform/Renderer back-end name (informational only! will be displayed in About Window) + User data for back-end/wrappers to store their own stuff.
1548  const char* BackendPlatformName; // = NULL
1549  const char* BackendRendererName; // = NULL
1550  void* BackendPlatformUserData; // = NULL // User data for platform back-end
1551  void* BackendRendererUserData; // = NULL // User data for renderer back-end
1552  void* BackendLanguageUserData; // = NULL // User data for non C++ programming language back-end
1553 
1554  // Optional: Access OS clipboard
1555  // (default to use native Win32 clipboard on Windows, otherwise uses a private clipboard. Override to access OS clipboard on other architectures)
1556  const char* (*GetClipboardTextFn)(void* user_data);
1557  void (*SetClipboardTextFn)(void* user_data, const char* text);
1558  void* ClipboardUserData;
1559 
1560 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1561  // [OBSOLETE since 1.60+] Rendering function, will be automatically called in Render(). Please call your rendering function yourself now!
1562  // You can obtain the ImDrawData* by calling ImGui::GetDrawData() after Render(). See example applications if you are unsure of how to implement this.
1563  void (*RenderDrawListsFn)(ImDrawData* data);
1564 #else
1565  // This is only here to keep ImGuiIO the same size/layout, so that IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS can exceptionally be used outside of imconfig.h.
1566  void* RenderDrawListsFnUnused;
1567 #endif
1568 
1569  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1570  // Input - Fill before calling NewFrame()
1571  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1572 
1573  ImVec2 MousePos; // Mouse position, in pixels. Set to ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) if mouse is unavailable (on another screen, etc.)
1574  bool MouseDown[5]; // Mouse buttons: 0=left, 1=right, 2=middle + extras (ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT == 5). Dear ImGui mostly uses left and right buttons. Others buttons allows us to track if the mouse is being used by your application + available to user as a convenience via IsMouse** API.
1575  float MouseWheel; // Mouse wheel Vertical: 1 unit scrolls about 5 lines text.
1576  float MouseWheelH; // Mouse wheel Horizontal. Most users don't have a mouse with an horizontal wheel, may not be filled by all back-ends.
1577  ImGuiID MouseHoveredViewport; // (Optional) When using multiple viewports: viewport the OS mouse cursor is hovering _IGNORING_ viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag, and _REGARDLESS_ of whether another viewport is focused. Set io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport if you can provide this info. If you don't imgui will infer the value using the rectangles and last focused time of the viewports it knows about (ignoring other OS windows).
1578  bool KeyCtrl; // Keyboard modifier pressed: Control
1579  bool KeyShift; // Keyboard modifier pressed: Shift
1580  bool KeyAlt; // Keyboard modifier pressed: Alt
1581  bool KeySuper; // Keyboard modifier pressed: Cmd/Super/Windows
1582  bool KeysDown[512]; // Keyboard keys that are pressed (ideally left in the "native" order your engine has access to keyboard keys, so you can use your own defines/enums for keys).
1583  float NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_COUNT]; // Gamepad inputs. Cleared back to zero by EndFrame(). Keyboard keys will be auto-mapped and be written here by NewFrame().
1584 
1585  // Functions
1586  IMGUI_API void AddInputCharacter(unsigned int c); // Queue new character input
1587  IMGUI_API void AddInputCharacterUTF16(ImWchar16 c); // Queue new character input from an UTF-16 character, it can be a surrogate
1588  IMGUI_API void AddInputCharactersUTF8(const char* str); // Queue new characters input from an UTF-8 string
1589  IMGUI_API void ClearInputCharacters(); // Clear the text input buffer manually
1590 
1591  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1592  // Output - Updated by NewFrame() or EndFrame()/Render()
1593  // (when reading from the io.WantCaptureMouse, io.WantCaptureKeyboard flags to dispatch your inputs, it is
1594  // generally easier and more correct to use their state BEFORE calling NewFrame(). See FAQ for details!)
1595  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1596 
1597  bool WantCaptureMouse; // Set when Dear ImGui will use mouse inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main game/application (either way, always pass on mouse inputs to imgui). (e.g. unclicked mouse is hovering over an imgui window, widget is active, mouse was clicked over an imgui window, etc.).
1598  bool WantCaptureKeyboard; // Set when Dear ImGui will use keyboard inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main game/application (either way, always pass keyboard inputs to imgui). (e.g. InputText active, or an imgui window is focused and navigation is enabled, etc.).
1599  bool WantTextInput; // Mobile/console: when set, you may display an on-screen keyboard. This is set by Dear ImGui when it wants textual keyboard input to happen (e.g. when a InputText widget is active).
1600  bool WantSetMousePos; // MousePos has been altered, back-end should reposition mouse on next frame. Rarely used! Set only when ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos flag is enabled.
1601  bool WantSaveIniSettings; // When manual .ini load/save is active (io.IniFilename == NULL), this will be set to notify your application that you can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory() and save yourself. Important: clear io.WantSaveIniSettings yourself after saving!
1602  bool NavActive; // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation is currently allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events) = a window is focused and it doesn't use the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs flag.
1603  bool NavVisible; // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation is visible and allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events).
1604  float Framerate; // Application framerate estimate, in frame per second. Solely for convenience. Rolling average estimation based on io.DeltaTime over 120 frames.
1605  int MetricsRenderVertices; // Vertices output during last call to Render()
1606  int MetricsRenderIndices; // Indices output during last call to Render() = number of triangles * 3
1607  int MetricsRenderWindows; // Number of visible windows
1608  int MetricsActiveWindows; // Number of active windows
1609  int MetricsActiveAllocations; // Number of active allocations, updated by MemAlloc/MemFree based on current context. May be off if you have multiple imgui contexts.
1610  ImVec2 MouseDelta; // Mouse delta. Note that this is zero if either current or previous position are invalid (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX), so a disappearing/reappearing mouse won't have a huge delta.
1611 
1612  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1613  // [Internal] Dear ImGui will maintain those fields. Forward compatibility not guaranteed!
1614  //------------------------------------------------------------------
1615 
1616  ImGuiKeyModFlags KeyMods; // Key mods flags (same as io.KeyCtrl/KeyShift/KeyAlt/KeySuper but merged into flags), updated by NewFrame()
1617  ImVec2 MousePosPrev; // Previous mouse position (note that MouseDelta is not necessary == MousePos-MousePosPrev, in case either position is invalid)
1618  ImVec2 MouseClickedPos[5]; // Position at time of clicking
1619  double MouseClickedTime[5]; // Time of last click (used to figure out double-click)
1620  bool MouseClicked[5]; // Mouse button went from !Down to Down
1621  bool MouseDoubleClicked[5]; // Has mouse button been double-clicked?
1622  bool MouseReleased[5]; // Mouse button went from Down to !Down
1623  bool MouseDownOwned[5]; // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window. We don't request mouse capture from the application if click started outside ImGui bounds.
1624  bool MouseDownWasDoubleClick[5]; // Track if button down was a double-click
1625  float MouseDownDuration[5]; // Duration the mouse button has been down (0.0f == just clicked)
1626  float MouseDownDurationPrev[5]; // Previous time the mouse button has been down
1627  ImVec2 MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[5]; // Maximum distance, absolute, on each axis, of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point
1628  float MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[5]; // Squared maximum distance of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point
1629  float KeysDownDuration[512]; // Duration the keyboard key has been down (0.0f == just pressed)
1630  float KeysDownDurationPrev[512]; // Previous duration the key has been down
1631  float NavInputsDownDuration[ImGuiNavInput_COUNT];
1632  float NavInputsDownDurationPrev[ImGuiNavInput_COUNT];
1633  ImWchar16 InputQueueSurrogate; // For AddInputCharacterUTF16
1634  ImVector<ImWchar> InputQueueCharacters; // Queue of _characters_ input (obtained by platform back-end). Fill using AddInputCharacter() helper.
1635 
1636  IMGUI_API ImGuiIO();
1637 };
1638 
1639 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1640 // Misc data structures
1641 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1642 
1643 // Shared state of InputText(), passed as an argument to your callback when a ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* flag is used.
1644 // The callback function should return 0 by default.
1645 // Callbacks (follow a flag name and see comments in ImGuiInputTextFlags_ declarations for more details)
1646 // - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion: Callback on pressing TAB
1647 // - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory: Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows
1648 // - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways: Callback on each iteration
1649 // - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter: Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.
1650 // - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize: Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string to grow.
1651 struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData
1652 {
1653  ImGuiInputTextFlags EventFlag; // One ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* // Read-only
1654  ImGuiInputTextFlags Flags; // What user passed to InputText() // Read-only
1655  void* UserData; // What user passed to InputText() // Read-only
1656 
1657  // Arguments for the different callback events
1658  // - To modify the text buffer in a callback, prefer using the InsertChars() / DeleteChars() function. InsertChars() will take care of calling the resize callback if necessary.
1659  // - If you know your edits are not going to resize the underlying buffer allocation, you may modify the contents of 'Buf[]' directly. You need to update 'BufTextLen' accordingly (0 <= BufTextLen < BufSize) and set 'BufDirty'' to true so InputText can update its internal state.
1660  ImWchar EventChar; // Character input // Read-write // [CharFilter] Replace character with another one, or set to zero to drop. return 1 is equivalent to setting EventChar=0;
1661  ImGuiKey EventKey; // Key pressed (Up/Down/TAB) // Read-only // [Completion,History]
1662  char* Buf; // Text buffer // Read-write // [Resize] Can replace pointer / [Completion,History,Always] Only write to pointed data, don't replace the actual pointer!
1663  int BufTextLen; // Text length (in bytes) // Read-write // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Exclude zero-terminator storage. In C land: == strlen(some_text), in C++ land: string.length()
1664  int BufSize; // Buffer size (in bytes) = capacity+1 // Read-only // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Include zero-terminator storage. In C land == ARRAYSIZE(my_char_array), in C++ land: string.capacity()+1
1665  bool BufDirty; // Set if you modify Buf/BufTextLen! // Write // [Completion,History,Always]
1666  int CursorPos; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always]
1667  int SelectionStart; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always] == to SelectionEnd when no selection)
1668  int SelectionEnd; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always]
1669 
1670  // Helper functions for text manipulation.
1671  // Use those function to benefit from the CallbackResize behaviors. Calling those function reset the selection.
1672  IMGUI_API ImGuiInputTextCallbackData();
1673  IMGUI_API void DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count);
1674  IMGUI_API void InsertChars(int pos, const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL);
1675  bool HasSelection() const { return SelectionStart != SelectionEnd; }
1676 };
1677 
1678 // Resizing callback data to apply custom constraint. As enabled by SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Callback is called during the next Begin().
1679 // NB: For basic min/max size constraint on each axis you don't need to use the callback! The SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() parameters are enough.
1680 struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData
1681 {
1682  void* UserData; // Read-only. What user passed to SetNextWindowSizeConstraints()
1683  ImVec2 Pos; // Read-only. Window position, for reference.
1684  ImVec2 CurrentSize; // Read-only. Current window size.
1685  ImVec2 DesiredSize; // Read-write. Desired size, based on user's mouse position. Write to this field to restrain resizing.
1686 };
1687 
1688 // [ALPHA] Rarely used / very advanced uses only. Use with SetNextWindowClass() and DockSpace() functions.
1689 // Important: the content of this class is still highly WIP and likely to change and be refactored
1690 // before we stabilize Docking features. Please be mindful if using this.
1691 // Provide hints:
1692 // - To the platform back-end via altered viewport flags (enable/disable OS decoration, OS task bar icons, etc.)
1693 // - To the platform back-end for OS level parent/child relationships of viewport.
1694 // - To the docking system for various options and filtering.
1695 struct ImGuiWindowClass
1696 {
1697  ImGuiID ClassId; // User data. 0 = Default class (unclassed). Windows of different classes cannot be docked with each others.
1698  ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // Hint for the platform back-end. If non-zero, the platform back-end can create a parent<>child relationship between the platform windows. Not conforming back-ends are free to e.g. parent every viewport to the main viewport or not.
1699  ImGuiViewportFlags ViewportFlagsOverrideSet; // Viewport flags to set when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
1700  ImGuiViewportFlags ViewportFlagsOverrideClear; // Viewport flags to clear when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
1701  ImGuiDockNodeFlags DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet; // [EXPERIMENTAL] Dock node flags to set when a window of this class is hosted by a dock node (it doesn't have to be selected!)
1702  ImGuiDockNodeFlags DockNodeFlagsOverrideClear; // [EXPERIMENTAL]
1703  bool DockingAlwaysTabBar; // Set to true to enforce single floating windows of this class always having their own docking node (equivalent of setting the global io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar)
1704  bool DockingAllowUnclassed; // Set to true to allow windows of this class to be docked/merged with an unclassed window.
1705 
1706  ImGuiWindowClass() { ClassId = 0; ParentViewportId = 0; ViewportFlagsOverrideSet = ViewportFlagsOverrideClear = 0x00; DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet = DockNodeFlagsOverrideClear = 0x00; DockingAlwaysTabBar = false; DockingAllowUnclassed = true; }
1707 };
1708 
1709 // Data payload for Drag and Drop operations: AcceptDragDropPayload(), GetDragDropPayload()
1710 struct ImGuiPayload
1711 {
1712  // Members
1713  void* Data; // Data (copied and owned by dear imgui)
1714  int DataSize; // Data size
1715 
1716  // [Internal]
1717  ImGuiID SourceId; // Source item id
1718  ImGuiID SourceParentId; // Source parent id (if available)
1719  int DataFrameCount; // Data timestamp
1720  char DataType[32+1]; // Data type tag (short user-supplied string, 32 characters max)
1721  bool Preview; // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse has been hovering the target item (nb: handle overlapping drag targets)
1722  bool Delivery; // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse button is released over the target item.
1723 
1724  ImGuiPayload() { Clear(); }
1725  void Clear() { SourceId = SourceParentId = 0; Data = NULL; DataSize = 0; memset(DataType, 0, sizeof(DataType)); DataFrameCount = -1; Preview = Delivery = false; }
1726  bool IsDataType(const char* type) const { return DataFrameCount != -1 && strcmp(type, DataType) == 0; }
1727  bool IsPreview() const { return Preview; }
1728  bool IsDelivery() const { return Delivery; }
1729 };
1730 
1731 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1732 // Obsolete functions (Will be removed! Read 'API BREAKING CHANGES' section in imgui.cpp for details)
1733 // Please keep your copy of dear imgui up to date! Occasionally set '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS' in imconfig.h to stay ahead.
1734 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1735 
1736 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1737 namespace ImGui
1738 {
1739  // OBSOLETED in 1.72 (from July 2019)
1740  static inline void TreeAdvanceToLabelPos() { SetCursorPosX(GetCursorPosX() + GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()); }
1741  // OBSOLETED in 1.71 (from June 2019)
1742  static inline void SetNextTreeNodeOpen(bool open, ImGuiCond cond = 0) { SetNextItemOpen(open, cond); }
1743  // OBSOLETED in 1.70 (from May 2019)
1744  static inline float GetContentRegionAvailWidth() { return GetContentRegionAvail().x; }
1745  // OBSOLETED in 1.69 (from Mar 2019)
1746  static inline ImDrawList* GetOverlayDrawList() { return GetForegroundDrawList(); }
1747  // OBSOLETED in 1.66 (from Sep 2018)
1748  static inline void SetScrollHere(float center_ratio=0.5f){ SetScrollHereY(center_ratio); }
1749  // OBSOLETED in 1.63 (between Aug 2018 and Sept 2018)
1750  static inline bool IsItemDeactivatedAfterChange() { return IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(); }
1751  // OBSOLETED in 1.61 (between Apr 2018 and Aug 2018)
1752  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat(const char* label, float* v, float step, float step_fast, int decimal_precision, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0); // Use the 'const char* format' version instead of 'decimal_precision'!
1753  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], int decimal_precision, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
1754  IMGUI_API bool InputFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], int decimal_precision, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);

1756  // OBSOLETED in 1.60 (between Dec 2017 and Apr 2018)
1757  static inline bool IsAnyWindowFocused() { return IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow); }
1758  static inline bool IsAnyWindowHovered() { return IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow); }
1759  static inline ImVec2 CalcItemRectClosestPoint(const ImVec2& pos, bool on_edge = false, float outward = 0.f) { IM_UNUSED(on_edge); IM_UNUSED(outward); IM_ASSERT(0); return pos; }
1760 }
1761 typedef ImGuiInputTextCallback ImGuiTextEditCallback; // OBSOLETED in 1.63 (from Aug 2018): made the names consistent
1762 typedef ImGuiInputTextCallbackData ImGuiTextEditCallbackData;
1763 #endif
